Qin Shi Huang was the son of King Zhuang Xiang of Qin. King Zhuang Xiang was a Qin hostage in Zhao. He saw LÃ¼ Buwei's concubine, was pleased with her, and took her. She gave birth to Shi Huang. He was born in Handan in the first month of King Zhao of Qin's forty-eighth year. When he was born, he was named Zheng and given the Zhao surname. At age thirteen, King Zhuang Xiang died, and Zheng succeeded him as king of Qin. At this time, Qin territory had already annexed Ba, Shu, and Hanzhong, passed through Wan and had Ying, and established Nanguo commandery; To the north it collected east of Shang commandery, having Hedong, Taiyuan, and Shangdang commanderies; To the east it reached Xingyang, extinguished the two Zhou, and established Sanchuan commandery. LÃ¼ Buwei became chancellor, was enfeoffed with one hundred thousand households, and titled Lord Wenxin. He recruited guests and wandering scholars, desiring to annex the world. Li Si was his attendant. Meng Ao, Wang Qi, Bi Gong, and others were generals. The king was young and had just ascended the throne. He entrusted state affairs to the ministers.

æ™‰é™½åï¼Œå…ƒå¹´ï¼Œå°‡è»è’™é©æ“Šå®šä¹‹ã€‚ äºŒå¹´ï¼Œéºƒå…¬å°‡å’æ”»å·ï¼Œæ–¬é¦–ä¸‰è¬ã€‚ ä¸‰å¹´ï¼Œè’™é©æ”»éŸ“ï¼Œå–åä¸‰åŸã€‚ ç‹é½®æ­»ã€‚ åæœˆï¼Œå°‡è»è’™é©æ”»é­æ°æš¢ã€æœ‰è©­ã€‚ æ­²å¤§é¥‘ã€‚ å››å¹´ï¼Œæ‹”æš¢ã€æœ‰è©­ã€‚ ä¸‰æœˆï¼Œè»ç½·ã€‚ ç§¦è³ªå­æ­¸è‡ªè¶™ï¼Œè¶™å¤ªå­å‡ºæ­¸åœ‹ã€‚ åæœˆåºšå¯…ï¼Œè—èŸ²å¾æ±æ–¹ä¾†ï¼Œè”½å¤©ã€‚ å¤©ä¸‹ç–«ã€‚ ç™¾å§“å…§ç²ŸåƒçŸ³ï¼Œæ‹œçˆµä¸€ç´šã€‚ äº”å¹´ï¼Œå°‡è»é©æ”»é­ï¼Œå®šé…¸æ£—ã€ç‡•ã€è™›ã€é•·å¹³ã€é›ä¸˜ã€å±±é™½åŸï¼Œçš†æ‹”ä¹‹ï¼Œå–äºŒååŸã€‚ åˆç½®æ±éƒ¡ã€‚ å†¬é›·ã€‚ å…­å¹´ï¼ŒéŸ“ã€é­ã€è¶™ã€è¡›ã€æ¥šå…±æ“Šç§¦ï¼Œå–å£½é™µã€‚ ç§¦å‡ºå…µï¼Œäº”åœ‹å…µç½·ã€‚ æ‹”è¡›ï¼Œè¿«æ±éƒ¡ï¼Œå…¶å›è§’ç‡å…¶æ”¯å±¬å¾™å±…é‡ç‹ï¼Œé˜»å…¶å±±ä»¥ä¿é­ä¹‹æ²³å…§ã€‚ ä¸ƒå¹´ï¼Œå½—æ˜Ÿå…ˆå‡ºæ±æ–¹ï¼Œè¦‹åŒ—æ–¹ï¼Œäº”æœˆè¦‹è¥¿æ–¹ã€‚ å°‡è»é©æ­»ã€‚ ä»¥æ”»é¾ã€å­¤ã€æ…¶éƒ½ï¼Œé‚„å…µæ”»æ±²ã€‚ å½—æ˜Ÿå¾©è¦‹è¥¿æ–¹åå…­æ—¥ã€‚ å¤å¤ªåæ­»ã€‚ å…«å¹´ï¼Œç‹å¼Ÿé•·å®‰å›æˆèŸœå°‡è»æ“Šè¶™ï¼Œåï¼Œæ­»å±¯ç•™ï¼Œè»åçš†æ–¬æ­»ï¼Œé·å…¶æ°‘æ–¼è‡¨æ´®ã€‚ å°‡è»å£æ­»ï¼Œå’å±¯ç•™ã€è’²é¶´åï¼Œæˆ®å…¶å°¸ã€‚ æ²³é­šå¤§ä¸Šï¼Œè¼•è»Šé‡é¦¬æ±å°±é£Ÿã€‚
Jinyang rebelled. In the first year, General Meng Ao struck and pacified it. In the second year, Bi Gong led troops to attack Juan and beheaded thirty thousand. In the third year, Meng Ao attacked Han and took thirteen cities. Wang Qi died. In the tenth month, General Meng Ao attacked Wei's Chang and Yougui. There was a great famine that year. In the fourth year, they pulled Chang and Yougui. In the third month, the army was dismissed. The Qin hostage returned from Zhao. The Zhao crown prince went out and returned to his state. In the tenth month on Gengyin day, locusts came from the east, covering the sky. There was an epidemic throughout the world. Commoners who donated one thousand shi of grain were bestowed nobility one level. In the fifth year, General Ao attacked Wei, pacified Suanzhao, Yan, Xu, Changping, Yongqiu, and Shanyang cities. He pulled them all and took twenty cities. They initially established Dong commandery. There was thunder in winter. In the sixth year, Han, Wei, Zhao, Wei, and Chu together struck Qin and took Shouling. Qin sent out troops, and the five states' troops were dismissed. They pulled Wei and pressed Dong commandery. Its ruler Jiao led his branches and relatives to move and reside in Yewang, blocking the mountains to preserve Wei's Henei. In the seventh year, a comet first appeared in the east, was seen in the north, and in the fifth month was seen in the west. General Ao died. They attacked Long, Gu, and Qingdu, then returned troops to attack Ji. The comet was again seen in the west for sixteen days. Xia Taihou died. In the eighth year, the king's younger brother Lord Chang'an Cheng Juan led troops to strike Zhao, rebelled, died at Tunliu. All army officials were beheaded and died. Their people were moved to Lintao. General Bi died. Troops at Tunliu and Puhe rebelled. Their corpses were mutilated. River fish greatly ascended. Light chariots and heavy horses went east to seek food.

Lao Ai was enfeoffed as Lord Changxin. He was given Shanyang land and ordered to reside there. Palaces, chariots, horses, clothes, gardens, enclosures, galloping, and hunting - Ai was indulged in all these. All matters, whether small or great, were decided by Ai. The Taiyuan commandery west of the river was again changed to Ai's state. In the ninth year, a comet was seen, or it crossed the sky. They attacked Wei's Yuan and Puying. In the fourth month, the emperor lodged at Yong. On Jiyou day, the king was crowned and belted with a sword. Lord Changxin Ai made rebellion and it was discovered. He falsified the king's imperial seal and the queen mother's seal to send county troops, guard troops, official riders, Rongdi lords and nobles, and attendants. He intended to attack the Qinian palace and cause rebellion. The king knew it and ordered Chancellor Lord Changping and Lord Changwen to send troops to attack Ai. They fought at Xianyang and beheaded several hundred. All were bestowed nobility, and the eunuchs who were in the battle were also bestowed nobility one level. Ai and the others were defeated and fled. He immediately ordered throughout the state: whoever captures Ai alive will be granted one million cash; whoever kills him, five hundred thousand. They completely obtained Ai and the others. Wei Wei Jie, Nei Shi Si, Zuo Yi Jie, Zhong Da Fu Ling Qi and twenty others all had their heads displayed on poles. They were torn apart by carts for display and their clans extinguished. And their attendants - the lighter ones became ghost firewood workers. And nobility was stripped and more than four thousand families were moved to Shu, each family to Fangling. This month had severe cold and freezing, with some dying. Yang Duan He attacked Yanshi. A comet was seen in the west, and again in the north, from Dou southward for eighty days. In the tenth year, Chancellor LÃ¼ Buwei was dismissed due to Lao Ai. Huan Yi became general. Qi and Zhao came to set up a wine feast. The Qi man Mao Jiao persuaded the Qin king saying: 'Qin is just making the world its business, yet Your Majesty has the name of having moved Mother Taihou. I fear the feudal lords will hear of it and thereby turn against Qin.' The Qin king then welcomed the Taihou at Yong and entered Xianyang, again residing in the Ganquan palace.
4
å¤§ç´¢ï¼Œé€å®¢ï¼Œææ–¯ä¸Šæ›¸èªªï¼Œä¹ƒæ­¢é€å®¢ä»¤ã€‚ ææ–¯å› èªªç§¦ç‹ï¼Œè«‹å…ˆå–éŸ“ä»¥æä»–åœ‹ï¼Œæ–¼æ˜¯ä½¿æ–¯ä¸‹éŸ“ã€‚ éŸ“ç‹æ‚£ä¹‹ã€‚ èˆ‡éŸ“éè¬€å¼±ç§¦ã€‚ å¤§æ¢äººå°‰ç¹šä¾†ï¼Œèªªç§¦ç‹æ›°ï¼šã€Œä»¥ç§¦ä¹‹å½Šï¼Œè«¸ä¾¯è­¬å¦‚éƒ¡ç¸£ä¹‹å›ï¼Œè‡£ä½†æè«¸ä¾¯åˆå¾ï¼Œç¿•è€Œå‡ºä¸æ„ï¼Œæ­¤ä¹ƒæ™ºä¼¯ã€å¤«å·®ã€æ¹£ç‹ä¹‹æ‰€ä»¥äº¡ä¹Ÿã€‚ é¡˜å¤§ç‹æ¯‹æ„›è²¡ç‰©ï¼Œè³‚å…¶è±ªè‡£ï¼Œä»¥äº‚å…¶è¬€ï¼Œä¸éäº¡ä¸‰åè¬é‡‘ï¼Œå‰‡è«¸ä¾¯å¯ç›¡ã€‚ã€ ç§¦ç‹å¾å…¶è¨ˆï¼Œè¦‹å°‰ç¹šäº¢ç¦®ï¼Œè¡£æœé£Ÿé£²èˆ‡ç¹šåŒã€‚ ç¹šæ›°ï¼šã€Œç§¦ç‹ç‚ºäººï¼Œèœ‚æº–ï¼Œé•·ç›®ï¼Œæ‘¯é³¥è†ºï¼Œè±ºè²ï¼Œå°‘æ©è€Œè™ç‹¼å¿ƒï¼Œå±…ç´„æ˜“å‡ºäººä¸‹ï¼Œå¾—å¿—äº¦è¼•é£Ÿäººã€‚ æˆ‘å¸ƒè¡£ï¼Œç„¶è¦‹æˆ‘å¸¸èº«è‡ªä¸‹æˆ‘ã€‚ èª ä½¿ç§¦ç‹å¾—å¿—æ–¼å¤©ä¸‹ï¼Œå¤©ä¸‹çš†ç‚ºè™œçŸ£ã€‚ ä¸å¯èˆ‡ä¹…æ¸¸ã€‚ã€ ä¹ƒäº¡å»ã€‚ ç§¦ç‹è¦ºï¼Œå›ºæ­¢ï¼Œä»¥ç‚ºç§¦åœ‹å°‰ï¼Œå’ç”¨å…¶è¨ˆç­–ã€‚ è€Œææ–¯ç”¨äº‹ã€‚
A great search was conducted and guests were expelled. Li Si presented a memorial persuading the king, and the expel guests command was stopped. Li Si therefore persuaded the Qin king, requesting to first take Han to frighten the other states. Thereupon he had Si go down to Han. The Han king was worried about it. With Han Fei he plotted to weaken Qin. The Daliang man Wei Liao came and persuaded the Qin king saying: 'With Qin's strength, the feudal lords are like rulers of commanderies and counties. I only fear that the feudal lords will ally together and suddenly strike unexpectedly. This is why Zhi Bo, Fu Cha, and King Min perished.' I wish Your Majesty not to love wealth and objects, but to bribe their powerful ministers to disrupt their plans. It will cost no more than three hundred thousand gold, and then the feudal lords can be exhausted.' The Qin king followed his plan. He saw Wei Liao with proud ceremony, and his clothes, food, and drink were the same as Liao's. Liao said: 'The Qin king as a person has a bee-like nose, long eyes, a determined bird-like breast, jackal voice, little kindness but a tiger-wolf heart. When in poverty he easily puts himself below others, but when he obtains his will he also lightly eats people.' I am in common clothes, yet when he sees me he often lowers himself below me.' Truly, if the Qin king obtains his will in the world, the world will all become captives.' One cannot travel with him for long.' He then fled away. The Qin king became aware and firmly stopped him. He made him the Wei of Qin state and finally used his strategies. And Li Si handled affairs.
5
åä¸€å¹´ï¼Œç‹ç¿¦ã€æ¡“é½®ã€æ¥Šç«¯å’Œæ”»é„´ï¼Œå–ä¹åŸã€‚ ç‹ç¿¦æ”»é–¼èˆ‡ã€æ©‘æ¥Šï¼Œçš†å¹¶ç‚ºä¸€è»ã€‚ ç¿¦å°‡åå…«æ—¥ï¼Œè»æ­¸æ–—é£Ÿä»¥ä¸‹ï¼Œä»€æ¨äºŒäººå¾è»å–é„´å®‰é™½ï¼Œæ¡“é½®å°‡ã€‚ åäºŒå¹´ï¼Œæ–‡ä¿¡ä¾¯ä¸éŸ‹æ­»ï¼Œç«Šè‘¬ã€‚ å…¶èˆäººè‡¨è€…ï¼Œæ™‰äººä¹Ÿé€å‡ºä¹‹ï¼› ç§¦äººå…­ç™¾çŸ³ä»¥ä¸Šå¥ªçˆµï¼Œé·ï¼› äº”ç™¾çŸ³ä»¥ä¸‹ä¸è‡¨ï¼Œé·ï¼Œå‹¿å¥ªçˆµã€‚ è‡ªä»Šä»¥ä¾†ï¼Œæ“åœ‹äº‹ä¸é“å¦‚å«ªæ¯ã€ä¸éŸ‹è€…ç±å…¶é–€ï¼Œè¦–æ­¤ã€‚ ç§‹ï¼Œå¾©å«ªæ¯èˆäººé·èœ€è€…ã€‚ ç•¶æ˜¯ä¹‹æ™‚ï¼Œå¤©ä¸‹å¤§æ—±ï¼Œå…­æœˆè‡³å…«æœˆä¹ƒé›¨ã€‚
In the eleventh year, Wang Jian, Huan Yi, and Yang Duan He attacked Ye and took nine cities. Wang Jian attacked Eyu and Laoyang, combining them all as one army. Jian was general for eighteen days. The army returned with those of dou shi rank and below. Every shi had two pushed to follow the army and take Ye and Anyang. Huan Yi was general. In the twelfth year, Lord Wenxin Buwei died and was secretly buried. His attendants who attended - the Jin people were also driven out; Qin people of six hundred shi rank and above had their nobility stripped and were moved; Those of five hundred shi rank and below who did not attend were moved but not stripped of nobility. From now on, those who handle state affairs improperly like Lao Ai and Buwei will have their gates registered. Regard this. In autumn, those who were Lao Ai's attendants and moved to Shu were again moved. At this time, there was a great drought throughout the world. It rained from the sixth month to the eighth month.
6
åä¸‰å¹´ï¼Œæ¡“é½®æ”»è¶™å¹³é™½ï¼Œæ®ºè¶™å°‡æ‰ˆè¼’ï¼Œæ–¬é¦–åè¬ã€‚ ç‹ä¹‹æ²³å—ã€‚ æ­£æœˆï¼Œå½—æ˜Ÿè¦‹æ±æ–¹ã€‚ åæœˆï¼Œæ¡“é½®æ”»è¶™ã€‚ åå››å¹´ï¼Œæ”»è¶™è»æ–¼å¹³é™½ï¼Œå–å®œå®‰ï¼Œç ´ä¹‹ï¼Œæ®ºå…¶å°‡è»ã€‚ æ¡“é½®å®šå¹³é™½ã€æ­¦åŸã€‚ éŸ“éä½¿ç§¦ï¼Œç§¦ç”¨ææ–¯è¬€ï¼Œç•™éï¼Œéæ­»é›²é™½ã€‚ éŸ“ç‹è«‹ç‚ºè‡£ã€‚
In the thirteenth year, Huan Yi attacked Zhao's Pingyang, killed Zhao's general Hu Zhe, and beheaded one hundred thousand. The king went to Henan. In the first month, a comet was seen in the east. In the tenth month, Huan Yi attacked Zhao. In the fourteenth year, they attacked the Zhao army at Pingyang, took Yian, broke it, and killed their general. Huan Yi pacified Pingyang and Wucheng. Han Fei was sent to Qin. Qin used Li Si's plan, detained Fei, and Fei died in Yunyang. The Han king requested to become a minister.
7
åäº”å¹´ï¼Œå¤§èˆˆå…µï¼Œä¸€è»è‡³é„´ï¼Œä¸€è»è‡³å¤ªåŸï¼Œå–ç‹¼å­Ÿã€‚ åœ°å‹•ã€‚ åå…­å¹´ä¹æœˆï¼Œç™¼å’å—åœ°éŸ“å—é™½å‡å®ˆé¨°ã€‚ åˆä»¤ç”·å­æ›¸å¹´ã€‚ é­ç»åœ°æ–¼ç§¦ã€‚ ç§¦ç½®éº—é‚‘ã€‚ åä¸ƒå¹´ï¼Œå…§å²é¨°æ”»éŸ“ï¼Œå¾—éŸ“ç‹å®‰ï¼Œç›¡ç´å…¶åœ°ï¼Œä»¥å…¶åœ°ç‚ºéƒ¡ï¼Œå‘½æ›°æ½å·ã€‚ åœ°å‹•ã€‚ è¯é™½å¤ªåå’ã€‚ æ°‘å¤§é¥‘ã€‚
In the fifteenth year, troops were greatly raised. One army went to Ye, one army to Taiyuan, and took Langmeng. There was an earthquake. In the ninth month of the sixteenth year, troops were sent to receive land from Han's Nanyang. Acting guard Teng. Males were initially ordered to register their age. Wei offered land to Qin. Qin established Liyi. In the seventeenth year, Nei Shi Teng attacked Han, got Han King An, and completely took his land. His land was made into a commandery named Yingchuan. There was an earthquake. Hua Yang Taihou died. The people suffered a great famine.
8
åå…«å¹´ï¼Œå¤§èˆˆå…µæ”»è¶™ï¼Œç‹ç¿¦å°‡ä¸Šåœ°ï¼Œä¸‹äº•é™˜ï¼Œç«¯å’Œå°‡æ²³å…§ï¼Œç¾Œç˜£ä¼è¶™ï¼Œç«¯å’Œåœé‚¯é„²åŸã€‚ åä¹å¹´ï¼Œç‹ç¿¦ã€ç¾Œç˜£ç›¡å®šå–è¶™åœ°æ±é™½ï¼Œå¾—è¶™ç‹ã€‚ å¼•å…µæ¬²æ”»ç‡•ï¼Œå±¯ä¸­å±±ã€‚ ç§¦ç‹ä¹‹é‚¯é„²ï¼Œè«¸å˜—èˆ‡ç‹ç”Ÿè¶™æ™‚æ¯å®¶æœ‰ä»‡æ€¨ï¼Œçš†é˜¬ä¹‹ã€‚ ç§¦ç‹é‚„ï¼Œå¾å¤ªåŸã€ä¸Šéƒ¡æ­¸ã€‚ å§‹çš‡å¸æ¯å¤ªåå´©ã€‚ è¶™å…¬å­å˜‰ç‡å…¶å®—æ•¸ç™¾äººä¹‹ä»£ï¼Œè‡ªç«‹ç‚ºä»£ç‹ï¼Œæ±èˆ‡ç‡•åˆå…µï¼Œè»ä¸Šè°·ã€‚ å¤§é¥‘ã€‚
In the eighteenth year, troops were greatly raised to attack Zhao. Wang Jian was general of the upper lands and descended through Jingxing. Duan He was general of Henei. Qiang Wei attacked Zhao, and Duan He surrounded Handan city. In the nineteenth year, Wang Jian and Qiang Wei completely pacified and took Zhao's Dongyang land and got the Zhao king. They led troops desiring to attack Yan and stationed at Zhongshan. The Qin king went to Handan. Those who once had enmities with the king's mother's family from when he was born in Zhao were all pit-killed. The Qin king returned, going back through Taiyuan and Shang commandery. Shi Huangdi's mother Taihou collapsed. Zhao Gong Zi Jia led several hundred of his clansmen to Dai, established himself as Dai king, combined troops with Yan to the east, and stationed at Shanggu. There was a great famine.

äºŒåå¹´ï¼Œç‡•å¤ªå­ä¸¹æ‚£ç§¦å…µè‡³åœ‹ï¼Œæï¼Œä½¿èŠè»»åˆºç§¦ç‹ã€‚ ç§¦ç‹è¦ºä¹‹ï¼Œé«”è§£è»»ä»¥å¾‡ï¼Œè€Œä½¿ç‹ç¿¦ã€è¾›å‹æ”»ç‡•ã€‚ ç‡•ã€ä»£ç™¼å…µæ“Šç§¦è»ï¼Œç§¦è»ç ´ç‡•æ˜“æ°´ä¹‹è¥¿ã€‚ äºŒåä¸€å¹´ï¼Œç‹è³æ”»ï¼ˆè–Šï¼‰ï¼»èŠï¼½ã€‚ ä¹ƒç›Šç™¼å’è©£ç‹ç¿¦è»ï¼Œé‚ç ´ç‡•å¤ªå­è»ï¼Œå–ç‡•è–ŠåŸï¼Œå¾—å¤ªå­ä¸¹ä¹‹é¦–ã€‚ ç‡•ç‹æ±æ”¶é¼æ±è€Œç‹ä¹‹ã€‚ ç‹ç¿¦è¬ç—…è€æ­¸ã€‚ æ–°é„­åã€‚ æ˜Œå¹³å›å¾™æ–¼éƒ¢ã€‚ å¤§é›¨é›ªï¼Œæ·±äºŒå°ºäº”å¯¸ã€‚
In the twentieth year, Yan Crown Prince Dan, worried that Qin troops would reach his state, feared, and had Jing Ke stab the Qin king. The Qin king became aware of it, had Ke bodily dismembered for display, and had Wang Jian and Xin Sheng attack Yan. Yan and Dai sent troops to strike the Qin army. The Qin army broke Yan west of the Yishui. In the twenty-first year, Wang Ben attacked Jing. They then additionally sent troops to Wang Jian's army, broke the Yan crown prince's army, took Yan's Ji city, and got Crown Prince Dan's head. The Yan king collected Liaodong to the east and became king there. Wang Jian declined due to illness and old age and returned. Xinzheng rebelled. Lord Changping moved to Ying. There was a great snowfall, two chi and five cun deep.

In the twenty-second year, Wang Ben attacked Wei, led river channels to irrigate Daliang, Daliang's city was damaged, its king requested surrender, and they completely took its land.

äºŒåä¸‰å¹´ï¼Œç§¦ç‹å¾©å¬ç‹ç¿¦ï¼Œå½Šèµ·ä¹‹ï¼Œä½¿å°‡æ“ŠèŠã€‚ å–é™³ä»¥å—è‡³å¹³è¼¿ï¼Œè™œèŠç‹ã€‚ ç§¦ç‹æ¸¸è‡³éƒ¢é™³ã€‚ èŠå°‡é …ç‡•ç«‹æ˜Œå¹³å›ç‚ºèŠç‹ï¼Œåç§¦æ–¼æ·®å—ã€‚ äºŒåå››å¹´ï¼Œç‹ç¿¦ã€è’™æ­¦æ”»èŠï¼Œç ´èŠè»ï¼Œæ˜Œå¹³å›æ­»ï¼Œé …ç‡•é‚è‡ªæ®ºã€‚
In the twenty-third year, the Qin king again summoned Wang Jian, forcibly raised him, and made him general to strike Jing. They took from Chen south to Pingyu and captured the Jing king. The Qin king toured to Yingchen. Jing's general Xiang Yan established Lord Changping as Jing king and rebelled against Qin in Huainan. In the twenty-fourth year, Wang Jian and Meng Wu attacked Jing, broke the Jing army, Lord Changping died, and Xiang Yan then committed suicide.

In the twenty-fifth year, troops were greatly raised, Wang Ben was made general, attacked Yan's Liaodong, and got Yan King Xi. They returned and attacked Dai, capturing Dai King Jia. Wang Jian then pacified Jing's land south of the Jiang; They surrendered the Yue jun and established Huiji commandery. In the fifth month, there was a great fu throughout the world.

In the twenty-sixth year, Qi King Jian and his chancellor Hou Sheng sent troops to guard his western border and did not connect with Qin. Qin had General Wang Ben attack Qi from south of Yan and got Qi King Jian.

ç§¦ç‹åˆå¹¶å¤©ä¸‹ï¼Œä»¤ä¸ç›¸ã€å¾¡å²æ›°ï¼šã€Œç•°æ—¥éŸ“ç‹ç´åœ°æ•ˆç’½ï¼Œè«‹ç‚ºè—©è‡£ï¼Œå·²è€Œå€ç´„ï¼Œèˆ‡è¶™ã€é­åˆå¾ç•”ç§¦ï¼Œæ•…èˆˆå…µèª…ä¹‹ï¼Œè™œå…¶ç‹ã€‚ å¯¡äººä»¥ç‚ºå–„ï¼Œåº¶å¹¾æ¯å…µé©ã€‚ è¶™ç‹ä½¿å…¶ç›¸æç‰§ä¾†ç´„ç›Ÿï¼Œæ•…æ­¸å…¶è³ªå­ã€‚ å·²è€Œå€ç›Ÿï¼Œåæˆ‘å¤ªåŸï¼Œæ•…èˆˆå…µèª…ä¹‹ï¼Œå¾—å…¶ç‹ã€‚ è¶™å…¬å­å˜‰ä¹ƒè‡ªç«‹ç‚ºä»£ç‹ï¼Œæ•…èˆ‰å…µæ“Šæ»…ä¹‹ã€‚ é­ç‹å§‹ç´„æœå…¥ç§¦ï¼Œå·²è€Œèˆ‡éŸ“ã€è¶™è¬€è¥²ç§¦ï¼Œç§¦å…µåèª…ï¼Œé‚ç ´ä¹‹ã€‚ èŠç‹ç»é’é™½ä»¥è¥¿ï¼Œå·²è€Œç•”ç´„ï¼Œæ“Šæˆ‘å—éƒ¡ï¼Œæ•…ç™¼å…µèª…ï¼Œå¾—å…¶ç‹ï¼Œé‚å®šå…¶èŠåœ°ã€‚ ç‡•ç‹æ˜äº‚ï¼Œå…¶å¤ªå­ä¸¹ä¹ƒé™°ä»¤èŠè»»ç‚ºè³Šï¼Œå…µåèª…ï¼Œæ»…å…¶åœ‹ã€‚ é½Šç‹ç”¨åå‹è¨ˆï¼Œçµ•ç§¦ä½¿ï¼Œæ¬²ç‚ºäº‚ï¼Œå…µåèª…ï¼Œè™œå…¶ç‹ï¼Œå¹³é½Šåœ°ã€‚ å¯¡äººä»¥çœ‡çœ‡ä¹‹èº«ï¼Œèˆˆå…µèª…æš´äº‚ï¼Œè³´å®—å»Ÿä¹‹éˆï¼Œå…­ç‹å’¸ä¼å…¶è¾œï¼Œå¤©ä¸‹å¤§å®šã€‚ ä»Šåè™Ÿä¸æ›´ï¼Œç„¡ä»¥ç¨±æˆåŠŸï¼Œå‚³å¾Œä¸–ã€‚ å…¶è­°å¸è™Ÿã€‚ã€ ä¸ç›¸ç¶°ã€å¾¡å²å¤§å¤«åŠ«ã€å»·å°‰æ–¯ç­‰çš†æ›°ï¼šã€Œæ˜”è€…äº”å¸åœ°æ–¹åƒé‡Œï¼Œå…¶å¤–ä¾¯æœå¤·æœè«¸ä¾¯æˆ–æœæˆ–å¦ï¼Œå¤©å­ä¸èƒ½åˆ¶ã€‚ ä»Šé™›ä¸‹èˆˆç¾©å…µï¼Œèª…æ®˜è³Šï¼Œå¹³å®šå¤©ä¸‹ï¼Œæµ·å…§ç‚ºéƒ¡ç¸£ï¼Œæ³•ä»¤ç”±ä¸€çµ±ï¼Œè‡ªä¸Šå¤ä»¥ä¾†æœªå˜—æœ‰ï¼Œäº”å¸æ‰€ä¸åŠã€‚ è‡£ç­‰è¬¹èˆ‡åšå£«è­°æ›°ï¼šã€å¤æœ‰å¤©çš‡ï¼Œæœ‰åœ°çš‡ï¼Œæœ‰æ³°çš‡ï¼Œæ³°çš‡æœ€è²´ã€‚ã€ è‡£ç­‰æ˜§æ­»ä¸Šå°Šè™Ÿï¼Œç‹ç‚ºã€æ³°çš‡ã€ã€‚ å‘½ç‚ºã€åˆ¶ã€ï¼Œä»¤ç‚ºã€è©”ã€ï¼Œå¤©å­è‡ªç¨±æ›°ã€æœ•ã€ã€‚ã€ ç‹æ›°ï¼šã€Œå»ã€æ³°ã€ï¼Œè‘—ã€çš‡ã€ï¼Œé‡‡ä¸Šå¤ã€å¸ã€ä½è™Ÿï¼Œè™Ÿæ›°ã€çš‡å¸ã€ã€‚ ä»–å¦‚è­°ã€‚ã€ åˆ¶æ›°ï¼šã€Œå¯ã€‚ã€ è¿½å°ŠèŠè¥„ç‹ç‚ºå¤ªä¸Šçš‡ã€‚ åˆ¶æ›°ï¼šã€Œæœ•èå¤ªå¤æœ‰è™Ÿæ¯‹è¬šï¼Œä¸­å¤æœ‰è™Ÿï¼Œæ­»è€Œä»¥è¡Œç‚ºè¬ã€‚ å¦‚æ­¤ï¼Œå‰‡å­è­°çˆ¶ï¼Œè‡£è­°å›ä¹Ÿï¼Œç”šç„¡è¬‚ï¼Œæœ•å¼—å–ç„‰ã€‚ è‡ªä»Šå·²ä¾†ï¼Œé™¤è¬šæ³•ã€‚ æœ•ç‚ºå§‹çš‡å¸ã€‚ å¾Œä¸–ä»¥è¨ˆæ•¸ï¼ŒäºŒä¸–ä¸‰ä¸–è‡³äºè¬ä¸–ï¼Œå‚³ä¹‹ç„¡çª®ã€‚ã€
When the Qin king initially united the world, he commanded the chancellor and imperial secretary saying: 'Previously, the Han king entered land and presented his seal, requesting to be a fief minister, but then he doubled the agreement and allied with Zhao and Wei to rebel against Qin. Therefore we raised troops and executed them, capturing their king. I considered it good, perhaps to cease weapons and armor.' The Zhao king had his chancellor Li Mu come to ally and covenant, therefore we returned their hostage son. But then they doubled the covenant and rebelled against our Taiyuan. Therefore we raised troops and executed them, getting their king. Zhao Gong Zi Jia then self-established as Dai king. Therefore we raised troops and struck to extinguish them. The Wei king initially agreed to submit and enter Qin, but then plotted with Han and Zhao to raid Qin. Qin's troops and officials executed them, then broke them. The Jing king offered west of Qingyang, but then rebelled against the agreement and struck our Nanguo commandery. Therefore we sent troops and executed them, got their king, and then pacified their Jing land. The Yan king was muddled and chaotic. His crown prince Dan secretly ordered Jing Ke to be a bandit. Our troops and officials executed them and extinguished their state. The Qi king used Hou Sheng's plan, cut off Qin envoys, and wished for rebellion. Our troops and officials executed them, captured their king, and pacified Qi land. I, with my tiny body, raised troops to execute violent chaos. Relying on the ancestral temple's spirit, the six kings all submitted to their crimes. The world is greatly settled.' Now if the name and title are not changed, there is no way to match our success and transmit it to later generations. Discuss the emperor title.' Chancellor Wan, Imperial Secretary Jie, Court Judge Si and others all said: 'Formerly the Five Emperors had territories of a thousand li. Beyond that were the hou fu and yi fu, where feudal lords either came to court or not, and the Son of Heaven could not control them. Now Your Majesty has raised righteous troops, executed remnant bandits, pacified and settled the world. Within the seas it is all commanderies and counties, laws and commands come from one unification. This has never existed since high antiquity, and the Five Emperors did not reach this. We ministers respectfully discussed with the scholars and said: 'In ancient times there was the Heaven Emperor, the Earth Emperor, and the Great Emperor. The Great Emperor is most noble.' We ministers, risking death, present the honored title: the king as 'Great Emperor'. Commands shall be called 'decrees', orders shall be called 'edicts', and the Son of Heaven shall call himself 'I'.' The king said: 'Remove 'great', attach 'emperor', adopt the high ancient 'emperor' position title, and be titled 'emperor.' The rest as discussed.' The decree said: 'Acceptable.' King Zhuang Xiang was retroactively honored as Great Supreme Emperor. The decree said: 'I have heard that in high antiquity there were titles but no posthumous names. In middle antiquity there were titles, and after death they used conduct as posthumous names. Like this, then sons would discuss fathers and ministers would discuss rulers. This is very meaningless. I will not take them. From now on, abolish the posthumous name method. I am the Beginning Emperor. Later generations shall count by generations: second generation, third generation, until ten thousand generations, transmitting endlessly.'

å§‹çš‡æ¨çµ‚å§‹äº”å¾·ä¹‹å‚³ï¼Œä»¥ç‚ºå‘¨å¾—ç«å¾·ï¼Œç§¦ä»£å‘¨å¾·ï¼Œå¾æ‰€ä¸å‹ã€‚ æ–¹ä»Šæ°´å¾·ä¹‹å§‹ï¼Œæ”¹å¹´å§‹ï¼Œæœè³€çš†è‡ªåæœˆæœ”ã€‚ è¡£æœæ—„æ—Œç¯€æ——çš†ä¸Šé»‘ã€‚ æ•¸ä»¥å…­ç‚ºç´€ï¼Œç¬¦ã€æ³•å† çš†å…­å¯¸ï¼Œè€Œè¼¿å…­å°ºï¼Œå…­å°ºç‚ºæ­¥ï¼Œä¹˜å…­é¦¬ã€‚ æ›´åæ²³æ›°å¾·æ°´ï¼Œä»¥ç‚ºæ°´å¾·ä¹‹å§‹ã€‚ å‰›æ¯…æˆ¾æ·±ï¼Œäº‹çš†æ±ºæ–¼æ³•ï¼Œåˆ»å‰Šæ¯‹ä»æ©å’Œç¾©ï¼Œç„¶å¾Œåˆäº”å¾·ä¹‹æ•¸ã€‚ æ–¼æ˜¯æ€¥æ³•ï¼Œä¹…è€…ä¸èµ¦ã€‚
The Beginning Emperor traced the transmission of the Five Virtues from end to beginning, believing Zhou got the fire virtue. Qin replaces Zhou's virtue, following what overcomes it. Just now is the beginning of the water virtue. Change the year beginning, and all court congratulations shall be from the first day of the tenth month. Clothes, yak tails, banners, staffs, and flags shall all be topped with black. Numbers shall use six as the record. Tallies and law caps shall all be six inches, the carriage six chi, six chi as a pace, and ride six horses. Change the name of the river to Virtue Water, to be the beginning of the water virtue. Be firm, resolute, fierce, and deep. All matters shall be decided by law. Be harsh and strict without benevolence, kindness, harmony, or righteousness. Only then will it match the Five Virtues number. Thereupon make the law urgent. Long-standing cases shall not be pardoned.

ä¸ç›¸ç¶°ç­‰è¨€ï¼šã€Œè«¸ä¾¯åˆç ´ï¼Œç‡•ã€é½Šã€èŠåœ°é ï¼Œä¸ç‚ºç½®ç‹ï¼Œæ¯‹ä»¥å¡«ä¹‹ã€‚ è«‹ç«‹è«¸å­ï¼Œå”¯ä¸Šå¹¸è¨±ã€‚ã€ å§‹çš‡ä¸‹å…¶è­°æ–¼ç¾¤è‡£ï¼Œç¾¤è‡£çš†ä»¥ç‚ºä¾¿ã€‚ å»·å°‰ææ–¯è­°æ›°ï¼šã€Œå‘¨æ–‡æ­¦æ‰€å°å­å¼ŸåŒå§“ç”šçœ¾ï¼Œç„¶å¾Œå±¬ç–é ï¼Œç›¸æ”»æ“Šå¦‚ä»‡è®ï¼Œè«¸ä¾¯æ›´ç›¸èª…ä¼ï¼Œå‘¨å¤©å­å¼—èƒ½ç¦æ­¢ã€‚ ä»Šæµ·å…§è³´é™›ä¸‹ç¥éˆä¸€çµ±ï¼Œçš†ç‚ºéƒ¡ç¸£ï¼Œè«¸å­åŠŸè‡£ä»¥å…¬è³¦ç¨…é‡è³è³œä¹‹ï¼Œç”šè¶³æ˜“åˆ¶ã€‚ å¤©ä¸‹ç„¡ç•°æ„ï¼Œå‰‡å®‰å¯§ä¹‹è¡“ä¹Ÿã€‚ ç½®è«¸ä¾¯ä¸ä¾¿ã€‚ã€ å§‹çš‡æ›°ï¼šã€Œå¤©ä¸‹å…±è‹¦æˆ°é¬¬ä¸ä¼‘ï¼Œä»¥æœ‰ä¾¯ç‹ã€‚ è³´å®—å»Ÿï¼Œå¤©ä¸‹åˆå®šï¼Œåˆå¾©ç«‹åœ‹ï¼Œæ˜¯æ¨¹å…µä¹Ÿï¼Œè€Œæ±‚å…¶å¯§æ¯ï¼Œè±ˆä¸é›£å“‰ï¼ å»·å°‰è­°æ˜¯ã€‚ã€
Chancellor Wan and others spoke: 'The feudal lords have just been broken. Yan, Qi, and Jing lands are far away. If we do not establish kings there, there is nothing with which to fill them. We request to establish the various sons. Only if Your Majesty fortunately permits.' The Beginning Emperor sent their discussion to the ministers. The ministers all thought it convenient. Court Judge Li Si discussed and said: 'The sons and younger brothers of the same surname whom Zhou Wen and Wu enfeoffed were very many. Then their connections became distant, and they attacked each other like enemies. The feudal lords executed and attacked each other mutually, and the Zhou Son of Heaven could not prohibit it. Now within the seas, relying on Your Majesty's divine spirit for one unification, it is all commanderies and counties. The various sons and merit ministers can be heavily rewarded and granted from public taxes. This is very sufficient and easy to control. If the world has no different intentions, then this is the method of peace and tranquility. Establishing feudal lords is inconvenient.' The Beginning Emperor said: 'The world together suffers from battle and struggle without stopping, because there are hou and kings. Relying on the ancestral temple, the world has just been settled, yet again to establish states - this plants soldiers, yet to seek its peace and rest, how could it not be difficult!' The Court Judge's discussion is correct.'

åˆ†å¤©ä¸‹ä»¥ç‚ºä¸‰åå…­éƒ¡ï¼Œéƒ¡ç½®å®ˆã€å°‰ã€ç›£ã€‚ æ›´åæ°‘æ›°ã€Œé»”é¦–ã€ã€‚ å¤§é…ºã€‚ æ”¶å¤©ä¸‹å…µï¼Œèšä¹‹å’¸é™½ï¼ŒéŠ·ä»¥ç‚ºé˜é»ï¼Œé‡‘äººåäºŒï¼Œé‡å„åƒçŸ³ï¼Œç½®å»·å®®ä¸­ã€‚ ä¸€æ³•åº¦è¡¡çŸ³ä¸ˆå°ºã€‚ è»ŠåŒè»Œã€‚ æ›¸åŒæ–‡å­—ã€‚ åœ°æ±è‡³æµ·æš¨æœé®®ï¼Œè¥¿è‡³è‡¨æ´®ã€ç¾Œä¸­ï¼Œå—è‡³åŒ—å‘æˆ¶ï¼ŒåŒ—æ“šæ²³ç‚ºå¡ï¼Œå¹¶é™°å±±è‡³é¼æ±ã€‚ å¾™å¤©ä¸‹è±ªå¯Œæ–¼å’¸é™½åäºŒè¬æˆ¶ã€‚ è«¸å»ŸåŠç« è‡ºã€ä¸Šæ—çš†åœ¨æ¸­å—ã€‚ ç§¦æ¯ç ´è«¸ä¾¯ï¼Œå¯«æ”¾å…¶å®®å®¤ï¼Œä½œä¹‹å’¸é™½åŒ—é˜ªä¸Šï¼Œå—è‡¨æ¸­ï¼Œè‡ªé›é–€ä»¥æ±è‡³æ¶‡ã€æ¸­ï¼Œæ®¿å±‹è¤‡é“å‘¨é–£ç›¸å±¬ã€‚ æ‰€å¾—è«¸ä¾¯ç¾äººé˜é¼“ï¼Œä»¥å……å…¥ä¹‹ã€‚
Divide the world into thirty-six commanderies. Each commandery shall have a shou, wei, and jian. Change the name of the people to 'qianshou'. There was a great fu. Collect the world's weapons and gather them at Xianyang. Melt them to make bells and jian. Make twelve gold people, each weighing one thousand shi, and place them in the court palace. Unify the laws, measures, balances, stones, zhang, and chi. Chariots shall have the same track width. Writing shall use the same characters. The land extends east to the sea and Chaoxian, west to Lintao and Qiangzhong, south to Beixianghu, north along the river as a barrier, and along Yinshan to Liaodong. Move one hundred twenty thousand households of the world's powerful and rich to Xianyang. The various temples, Zhangtai, and Shanglin are all south of the Wei. Whenever Qin broke feudal lords, it copied and modeled their palaces and chambers, making them on Xianyang's northern slope, facing south toward the Wei. From Yong gate eastward to the Jing and Wei, hall houses, covered ways, winding pavilions were connected. The beauties, bells, and drums obtained from the feudal lords were used to fill and enter them.

In the twenty-seventh year, the Beginning Emperor toured Longxi and Beidi, came out at Jitoushan, and passed through Huizhong. There he made the Xin palace south of the Wei. He already changed the name of Xin palace to Ji temple, imitating the heaven extreme. From Ji temple a road connected to Lishan, where he made the Ganquan front hall. He built a covered way connecting it from Xianyang. This year, nobility one level was granted. Administer the gallop roads.

äºŒåå…«å¹´ï¼Œå§‹çš‡æ±è¡Œéƒ¡ç¸£ï¼Œä¸Šé„’å¶§å±±ã€‚ ç«‹çŸ³ï¼Œèˆ‡é­¯è«¸å„’ç”Ÿè­°ï¼Œåˆ»çŸ³é Œç§¦å¾·ï¼Œè­°å°ç¦ªæœ›ç¥­å±±å·ä¹‹äº‹ã€‚ ä¹ƒé‚ä¸Šæ³°å±±ï¼Œç«‹çŸ³ï¼Œå°ï¼Œç¥ ç¥€ã€‚ ä¸‹ï¼Œé¢¨é›¨æš´è‡³ï¼Œä¼‘æ–¼æ¨¹ä¸‹ï¼Œå› å°å…¶æ¨¹ç‚ºäº”å¤§å¤«ã€‚ ç¦ªæ¢çˆ¶ã€‚ åˆ»æ‰€ç«‹çŸ³ï¼Œå…¶è¾­æ›°ï¼š
In the twenty-eighth year, the Beginning Emperor traveled east through the commanderies and counties, ascending Zoui Shan. He erected a stone and discussed with various Lu scholar disciples, carving on the stone praise for Qin's virtue, and discussed the feng and shan sacrifices and hoped-for sacrifices to mountains and rivers. He then ascended Taishan, erected a stone, performed the feng sacrifice, and made sacrificial offerings. On descending, wind and rain arrived violently. The emperor assumes his position, makes systems and clear laws, ministers below repair their conduct. In the twenty-sixth year, initially uniting the world, none did not submit and obey. In the twenty-eighth year, the emperor made the beginning. Upright and level laws and measures, the record of the ten thousand things. With this to clarify human affairs, unite father and son in contract. Holy wisdom, benevolence, and righteousness manifest and make white the principles and way. Eastward he strokes the eastern lands, to inspect the soldiers and scholars. Affairs already greatly finished, then he approached the sea. The emperor's merit encourages toil in fundamental affairs. Honor agriculture, eliminate trade, the qianshou are rich thereby. Under universal heaven, unite hearts and bow wills. Instruments and weapons have one measure, same writing and characters. What the sun and moon shine upon, what boats and carriages carry. All complete their fate, none do not obtain their intention. Respond to the time and move affairs, this is only the emperor. Aid and correct different customs, cross waters and measure the earth. Worry and pity the qianshou, morning and evening not slack. Remove doubts and establish laws, all know what to avoid. Fang bo divide their duties, various administrations manage easily. Raise and lower must be proper, none not as planned. The emperor's brightness oversees and inspects the four directions. Honor and base, noble and base, do not exceed their order and conduct. Langye does not tolerate, all strive for chastity and goodness. Fine and large exhaust their strength, none dare be lazy or neglect. Distant and near avoid concealment, specialized in striving for solemnity and dignity. Upright and straight, sincere and loyal, affairs have constancy. The emperor's virtue preserves and stabilizes the four extremes. Execute chaos and remove harm, raise benefit and bring fortune. Restrain affairs by time, various productions multiply. The qianshou are peaceful and tranquil, not using weapons or armor. The six relatives mutually protect, ultimately without bandits or robbers. Joyful and happy receiving teaching, completely know the laws and forms. Within the six directions, the emperor's soil. West ford the flowing sands, south exhaust the north doors. East has the Eastern Sea, north passes Great Xia. Where human tracks reach, none are not subjects. Merit covers the Five Emperors, favor reaches oxen and horses. None do not receive virtue, each peaceful in their dwelling.

Only the Qin king united and possessed the world, established the name as emperor, then stroked the eastern lands, reaching Langye. Liehou Wucheng Hou Wang Li, liehou Tongwu Hou Wang Ben, lunhou Jiancheng Hou Zhao Hai, lunhou Changwu Hou Cheng, lunhou Wuxin Hou Feng Wu Ze, Chancellor Wei Lin, Chancellor Wang Wan, Qing Li Si, Qing Wang Wu, Five Great Men Zhao Ying, Five Great Men Yang Qiao followed, and discussed at the seaside. Said: 'The ancient emperors' lands did not exceed a thousand li. The feudal lords each guarded their fief domains, some came to court and some did not. They mutually invaded and caused violent chaos, cruel attacks did not stop. Still they carved metal and stone, to be their own record. The ancient Five Emperors and Three Kings had different knowledge and teachings, unclear laws and measures. They borrowed the power of ghosts and spirits to deceive distant places. In reality they did not match their name, therefore they were not long-lasting. While they were still alive, the feudal lords doubled their rebellion, laws and commands were not carried out. Now the emperor unites the one within the seas, makes it commanderies and counties, the world is peaceful. Brightly clear the ancestral temple, embody the way and practice virtue, honored title greatly completed. The ministers mutually recite the emperor's merit and virtue, carve on metal and stone, to be the standard classic.'

The Beginning Emperor returned, passed through Pengcheng, fasted and purified himself while praying and sacrificing, wishing to bring out the Zhou ding from the Si River. He floated down the Yangtze, reaching Xiangshan to sacrifice. He encountered a great wind and almost could not cross. His Majesty asked the scholars, saying: 'Is the Xiangjun a spirit?' The scholars answered, saying: 'I have heard that she was Yao's daughter, Shun's wife, and was buried here.' Thereupon the Beginning Emperor greatly angered, had three thousand criminals all cut down Xiangshan's trees, and reddened the mountain. His Majesty returned from Nanhun commandery by way of Wu Pass.

In the twenty-ninth year, at the time of mid-spring, when yang harmony had just arisen. The emperor toured eastward, patrolled and ascended Zhifu, overlooked and was illuminated by the sea. The attendant ministers admired the view, traced and thought of the auspicious achievements, pursued and recited the origins and beginning. The great sage made governance, established and determined laws and measures, manifestly displayed the outlines and order. Outwardly taught the feudal lords, brightly bestowed cultured benevolence, clarified with righteousness and principle. The six states were rebellious and evil, greedy and ferocious without satisfaction, cruelly killed without stopping. The emperor pitied the multitude, then sent a punitive army, aroused and raised martial virtue. Righteous executions were carried out with trustworthiness, awe and splendor broadly reached, none did not submit and obey. He boiled and extinguished the strong and violent, shook and saved the qianshou, comprehensively determined the four extremes. Universally bestowed clear laws, the warp and weft of the world, eternally as model and standard. How great indeed! In the midst of the universe and prefectures, received and obeyed the holy intention. The ministers recited the merit, requested it be carved on stone, tablet hung on the constant form.

Its eastern view said: In the twenty-ninth year, the emperor toured in spring, viewed and inspected distant places. He reached the sea corner, then ascended Zhifu, brightly approached the morning sun. Viewed and gazed at the broad beauty, attendant ministers all reflected, traced the way to utmost clarity. Holy laws initially arose, cleared and purified within the borders, outward executed the violent and strong. Martial might broadly spread, shook and moved the four extremes, captured and extinguished the six kings. Clarified and united the world, harm and injury absolutely ceased, eternally laid aside weapons and soldiers. The emperor's bright virtue managed and regulated within the universe, sight and hearing not slack. Made and established great righteousness, brightly prepared equipment and instruments, all had chapter banners. Office ministers complied with their divisions, each knew what to carry out, matters without suspicion or doubt. The qianshou transformed and changed, distant and near the same measure, faced the ancient and cut off the exceptional. Constant offices already determined, later descendants followed the enterprise, long received holy governance. The ministers praised the virtue, respectfully recited the holy achievements, requested it be carved on Zhifu.

Then aroused troops and armies, executed and slaughtered the without-way, rebellious extinguished and ceased. Martial extinguished the violent and rebellious, civil restored the innocent, the populace's hearts all submitted. Benevolence evaluated merit and labor, rewards reached oxen and horses, favor enriched the soil and domain. The emperor exerted might, virtue united the feudal lords, initially unified great peace. Destroyed and ruined city walls, breached and connected river defenses, leveled and removed dangers and obstacles. The earth's situation already determined, common people without worries, the world all pacified. Males were happy in their fields, females cultivated their occupations, matters each had order. Benevolence covered various productions, long united the come fields, none not peaceful in their place. The ministers recited the achievements, requested this stone be carved, hung and displayed as model and standard.

Therefore he had Han Zhong, Hou Gong, and Shi Sheng seek the xian people's medicine of immortality. The Beginning Emperor toured the northern border, entering from Shang commandery. The Yan person Lu Sheng was made to enter the sea and return, with matters of ghosts and spirits, then he memorialed and presented recorded writings, saying 'The one who will destroy Qin will be Hu.' The Beginning Emperor then had General Meng Tian send three hundred thousand troops to strike north at the Hu, roughly taking the Henan lands.

In the thirty-third year, he sent various once fled and absconded people, debt sons-in-law, and merchants to roughly take the Lu Liang lands, making them Guilin, Xiang commandery, and Nanhai, to fit sending garrisons. To the northwest he drove out the Xiongnu. From Yuzhong along the river eastward, connected to Yinshan, made into forty-four counties, walled the river top as a barrier. Again he had Meng Tian cross the river to take Banque, Yangshan, and Beijiazhong, building pavilion barriers to drive out the Rong people. He moved the banished and filled the new counties with them. He prohibited those who could not sacrifice. A bright star appeared in the western direction. In the thirty-fourth year, he punished and handled prison officials who were not upright, building the long wall and into the Nan Yue lands.

å§‹çš‡ç½®é…’å’¸é™½å®®ï¼Œåšå£«ä¸ƒåäººå‰ç‚ºå£½ã€‚ ä»†å°„å‘¨é’è‡£é€²é Œæ›°ï¼šã€Œä»–æ™‚ç§¦åœ°ä¸éåƒé‡Œï¼Œè³´é™›ä¸‹ç¥éˆæ˜è–ï¼Œå¹³å®šæµ·å…§ï¼Œæ”¾é€è »å¤·ï¼Œæ—¥æœˆæ‰€ç…§ï¼Œè«ä¸è³“æœã€‚ ä»¥è«¸ä¾¯ç‚ºéƒ¡ç¸£ï¼Œäººäººè‡ªå®‰æ¨‚ï¼Œç„¡æˆ°çˆ­ä¹‹æ‚£ï¼Œå‚³ä¹‹è¬ä¸–ã€‚ è‡ªä¸Šå¤ä¸åŠé™›ä¸‹å¨å¾·ã€‚ã€ å§‹çš‡æ‚…ã€‚ åšå£«é½Šäººæ·³äºè¶Šé€²æ›°ï¼šã€Œè‡£èæ®·å‘¨ä¹‹ç‹åƒé¤˜æ­²ï¼Œå°å­å¼ŸåŠŸè‡£ï¼Œè‡ªç‚ºæè¼”ã€‚ ä»Šé™›ä¸‹æœ‰æµ·å…§ï¼Œè€Œå­å¼Ÿç‚ºåŒ¹å¤«ï¼Œå’æœ‰ç”°å¸¸ã€å…­å¿ä¹‹è‡£ï¼Œç„¡è¼”æ‹‚ï¼Œä½•ä»¥ç›¸æ•‘å“‰ï¼Ÿ äº‹ä¸å¸«å¤è€Œèƒ½é•·ä¹…è€…ï¼Œéæ‰€èä¹Ÿã€‚ ä»Šé’è‡£åˆé¢è«›ä»¥é‡é™›ä¸‹ä¹‹éï¼Œéå¿ è‡£ã€‚ã€ å§‹çš‡ä¸‹å…¶è­°ã€‚ ä¸ç›¸ææ–¯æ›°ï¼šã€Œäº”å¸ä¸ç›¸å¾©ï¼Œä¸‰ä»£ä¸ç›¸è¥²ï¼Œå„ä»¥æ²»ï¼Œéå…¶ç›¸åï¼Œæ™‚è®Šç•°ä¹Ÿã€‚ ä»Šé™›ä¸‹å‰µå¤§æ¥­ï¼Œå»ºè¬ä¸–ä¹‹åŠŸï¼Œå›ºéæ„šå„’æ‰€çŸ¥ã€‚ ä¸”è¶Šè¨€ä¹ƒä¸‰ä»£ä¹‹äº‹ï¼Œä½•è¶³æ³•ä¹Ÿï¼Ÿ ç•°æ™‚è«¸ä¾¯å¹¶çˆ­ï¼Œåšæ‹›æ¸¸å­¸ã€‚ ä»Šå¤©ä¸‹å·²å®šï¼Œæ³•ä»¤å‡ºä¸€ï¼Œç™¾å§“ç•¶å®¶å‰‡åŠ›è¾²å·¥ï¼Œå£«å‰‡å­¸ç¿’æ³•ä»¤è¾Ÿç¦ã€‚ ä»Šè«¸ç”Ÿä¸å¸«ä»Šè€Œå­¸å¤ï¼Œä»¥éç•¶ä¸–ï¼Œæƒ‘äº‚é»”é¦–ã€‚ ä¸ç›¸è‡£æ–¯æ˜§æ­»è¨€ï¼šå¤è€…å¤©ä¸‹æ•£äº‚ï¼Œè«ä¹‹èƒ½ä¸€ï¼Œæ˜¯ä»¥è«¸ä¾¯å¹¶ä½œï¼Œèªçš†é“å¤ä»¥å®³ä»Šï¼Œé£¾è™›è¨€ä»¥äº‚å¯¦ï¼Œäººå–„å…¶æ‰€ç§å­¸ï¼Œä»¥éä¸Šä¹‹æ‰€å»ºç«‹ã€‚ ä»Šçš‡å¸å¹¶æœ‰å¤©ä¸‹ï¼Œåˆ¥é»‘ç™½è€Œå®šä¸€å°Šã€‚ ç§å­¸è€Œç›¸èˆ‡éæ³•æ•™ï¼Œäººèä»¤ä¸‹ï¼Œå‰‡å„ä»¥å…¶å­¸è­°ä¹‹ï¼Œå…¥å‰‡å¿ƒéï¼Œå‡ºå‰‡å··è­°ï¼Œå¤¸ä¸»ä»¥ç‚ºåï¼Œç•°å–ä»¥ç‚ºé«˜ï¼Œç‡ç¾¤ä¸‹ä»¥é€ è¬—ã€‚ å¦‚æ­¤å¼—ç¦ï¼Œå‰‡ä¸»å‹¢é™ä¹ä¸Šï¼Œé»¨èˆ‡æˆä¹ä¸‹ã€‚ ç¦ä¹‹ä¾¿ã€‚ è‡£è«‹å²å®˜éç§¦è¨˜çš†ç‡’ä¹‹ã€‚ éåšå£«å®˜æ‰€è·ï¼Œå¤©ä¸‹æ•¢æœ‰è—è©©ã€æ›¸ã€ç™¾å®¶èªè€…ï¼Œæ‚‰è©£å®ˆã€å°‰é›œç‡’ä¹‹ã€‚ æœ‰æ•¢å¶èªè©©æ›¸è€…æ£„å¸‚ã€‚ ä»¥å¤éä»Šè€…æ—ã€‚ åè¦‹çŸ¥ä¸èˆ‰è€…èˆ‡åŒç½ªã€‚ ä»¤ä¸‹ä¸‰åæ—¥ä¸ç‡’ï¼Œé»¥ç‚ºåŸæ—¦ã€‚ æ‰€ä¸å»è€…ï¼Œé†«è—¥åœç­®ç¨®æ¨¹ä¹‹æ›¸ã€‚ è‹¥æ¬²æœ‰å­¸æ³•ä»¤ï¼Œä»¥åç‚ºå¸«ã€‚ã€ åˆ¶æ›°ï¼šã€Œå¯ã€‚ã€
The Beginning Emperor set wine at Xianyang palace, seventy scholars before him wished him longevity. Pushe Zhou Qingchen advanced and praised, saying: 'In other times Qin's lands did not exceed a thousand li. Relying on Your Majesty's divine spirit and clear holiness, he pacified and settled within the seas, drove out the barbarian Yi. What the sun and moon shone upon, none did not submit and obey. He made the feudal lords into commanderies and counties. People each were peaceful and happy by themselves, without the troubles of warfare, transmitted to ten thousand generations. From high antiquity it did not reach Your Majesty's might and virtue.' The Beginning Emperor was pleased. Scholar Qi person Chun Yuyue advanced and said: 'I, your minister, have heard that the kings of Yin and Zhou lasted over a thousand years. They enfeoffed sons, younger brothers, and meritorious ministers, themselves making branch supports. Now Your Majesty possesses within the seas, yet sons and younger brothers are common men. Suddenly there are ministers like Tian Chang and the Six Ministers, without support or brush, how can they mutually save each other?' Affairs that do not take ancient as teacher yet are able to last long, are not what I have heard. Now Qingchen also flatters to the face to increase Your Majesty's errors. He is not a loyal minister.' The Beginning Emperor sent down their discussion. Chancellor Li Si said: 'The Five Emperors did not mutually repeat, the Three Dynasties did not mutually follow. Each governed with what was appropriate, not opposing and reversing each other. Time changed and was different. Now Your Majesty has created a great enterprise, established merit for ten thousand generations. This is certainly not what foolish scholars know. Moreover, Yue's words are matters of the Three Dynasties. What are they sufficient to model? In different times the feudal lords together contended, thickly recruiting wandering scholars. Now the world is already determined, laws and commands come out as one. When common people are at home they exert themselves in agriculture and labor, scholars study and learn the laws and commands to avoid prohibitions. Now the various scholars do not take the present as teacher but study the ancient, to oppose the current age, confusing and disordering the qianshou. Chancellor Minister Si, risking death, speaks: In ancient times the world was scattered and chaotic, none could unify it. Therefore the feudal lords together arose. Their words all spoke of ancient to harm the present, adorned empty words to disorder reality. People favored their private studies to oppose what superiors established. Now the emperor has united the world, distinguishes black and white and determines one honored. Private studies mutually go with illegal teachings. When people hear commands descend, they each discuss them with their studies. Entering, their hearts oppose; exiting, they discuss in alleys. They boast of their master as a name, take different things as high, lead the group below to make slander. Like this if not prohibited, then the ruler's power descends to the superiors, factions and alliances form below. Prohibiting it is convenient. I, your minister, request that court historians burn all records that are not of Qin. Those not in the charge of scholar officials: throughout the world, whoever dares hide poems, books, or the words of the hundred schools, shall completely go to the commandery governors and commandery lieutenants to mix and burn them. Whoever dares to discuss poems and books in pairs shall be abandoned in the market. Those who use ancient to oppose the present shall be clanned. Officials who see and know but do not report shall share the same crime. If the command descends thirty days and they do not burn, tattoo them as city morning. What shall not be removed: books of medicine, divination, planting trees. If they desire to study the laws and commands, take officials as teachers.' The decree said: 'Approved.'

In the thirty-fifth year, he cleared roads, the road from Jiuyuan reaching Yunyang, moating mountains and filling valleys, directly connecting them. Thereupon the Beginning Emperor thought Xianyang had many people, the palace courts of former kings were small. I have heard that King Wen of Zhou made his capital at Feng, King Wu made his capital at Hao. Between Feng and Hao is the capital of emperors and kings. Then he planned and made a court palace in the Shanglin Park south of the Wei. He first made the front hall Epang, five hundred paces east to west, fifty zhang north to south. Above it can seat ten thousand people, below it can erect five zhang flags. He circled and galloped as a covered way, from below the hall straight to the southern mountain. He marked the southern mountain's summit as a que. He made a covered way, from Epang crossing the Wei, connecting to Xianyang, to imitate the heaven extreme covered way cutting the Han reaching Yingshi. The Epang Palace was not completed; When completed, he wished moreover to choose a good name and name it. He made the palace Epang, therefore the world called it the Epang Palace. He sent over seven hundred thousand criminals to the secret palace, then divided them to make the Epang Palace, or to make Lishan. He sent for stone coffins from Beishan, then copied timbers from Shu and Jing lands, all arrived. Within Guan were counted three hundred palaces, outside Guan four hundred more. Thereupon he erected a stone in the middle of Shangqu's boundary on the eastern sea, to be Qin's eastern gate. Therefore he moved thirty thousand households to Liyi, fifty thousand households to Yunyang, all exempt from service for ten years.

ç›§ç”Ÿèªªå§‹çš‡æ›°ï¼šã€Œè‡£ç­‰æ±‚èŠå¥‡è—¥åƒŠè€…å¸¸å¼—é‡ï¼Œé¡ç‰©æœ‰å®³ä¹‹è€…ã€‚ æ–¹ä¸­ï¼Œäººä¸»æ™‚ç‚ºå¾®è¡Œä»¥è¾Ÿæƒ¡é¬¼ï¼Œæƒ¡é¬¼è¾Ÿï¼ŒçœŸäººè‡³ã€‚ äººä¸»æ‰€å±…è€Œäººè‡£çŸ¥ä¹‹ï¼Œå‰‡å®³æ–¼ç¥ã€‚ çœŸäººè€…ï¼Œå…¥æ°´ä¸æ¿¡ï¼Œå…¥ç«ä¸çˆ‡ï¼Œé™µé›²æ°£ï¼Œèˆ‡å¤©åœ°ä¹…é•·ã€‚ ä»Šä¸Šæ²»å¤©ä¸‹ï¼Œæœªèƒ½æ¬å€“ã€‚ é¡˜ä¸Šæ‰€å±…å®®æ¯‹ä»¤äººçŸ¥ï¼Œç„¶å¾Œä¸æ­»ä¹‹è—¥æ®†å¯å¾—ä¹Ÿã€‚ã€ æ–¼æ˜¯å§‹çš‡æ›°ï¼šã€Œå¾æ…•çœŸäººï¼Œè‡ªè¬‚ã€çœŸäººã€ï¼Œä¸ç¨±ã€æœ•ã€ã€‚ã€ ä¹ƒä»¤å’¸é™½ä¹‹æ—äºŒç™¾é‡Œå…§å®®è§€äºŒç™¾ä¸ƒåå¾©é“ç”¬é“ç›¸é€£ï¼Œå¸·å¸³é˜é¼“ç¾äººå……ä¹‹ï¼Œå„æ¡ˆç½²ä¸ç§»å¾™ã€‚ è¡Œæ‰€å¹¸ï¼Œæœ‰è¨€å…¶è™•è€…ï¼Œç½ªæ­»ã€‚ å§‹çš‡å¸å¹¸æ¢å±±å®®ï¼Œå¾å±±ä¸Šè¦‹ä¸ç›¸è»Šé¨çœ¾ï¼Œå¼—å–„ä¹Ÿã€‚ ä¸­äººæˆ–å‘Šä¸ç›¸ï¼Œä¸ç›¸å¾Œæè»Šé¨ã€‚ å§‹çš‡æ€’æ›°ï¼šã€Œæ­¤ä¸­äººæ³„å¾èªã€‚ã€ æ¡ˆå•è«æœã€‚ ç•¶æ˜¯æ™‚ï¼Œè©”æ•è«¸æ™‚åœ¨æ—è€…ï¼Œçš†æ®ºä¹‹ã€‚ è‡ªæ˜¯å¾Œè«çŸ¥è¡Œä¹‹æ‰€åœ¨ã€‚ è½äº‹ï¼Œç¾¤è‡£å—æ±ºäº‹ï¼Œæ‚‰æ–¼å’¸é™½å®®ã€‚
Lu Sheng persuaded the Beginning Emperor, saying: 'We ministers seek ling and strange medicines, xian ones, often do not encounter them. Similar things have ones that are harmful to them. In the square, the person lord at times makes secret journeys to avoid evil ghosts. Evil ghosts avoid, true people arrive. If the person lord dwells somewhere and person ministers know it, then it harms the spirits. True people enter water without getting wet, enter fire without getting scorched, tread on cloud qi, lasting long with heaven and earth. Now His Majesty governs the world, not yet tranquil and calm. I wish that His Majesty's dwelling palaces not be known to people, then the medicine of immortality might almost be obtainable.' Thereupon the Beginning Emperor said: 'I admire true people. I call myself 'True Person', I do not use 'I'.' Then he ordered within two hundred li of Xianyang's side two hundred seventy palace buildings with covered ways and walled ways connected, filled with curtains, canopies, bells, drums, and beauties, each according to name not to move or transfer. Wherever he travels and favors, whoever speaks of its place, crime of death. The Beginning Emperor favored the Liangshan Palace. From the mountain top he saw the chancellor's chariots and cavalry were many. He did not think it good. Inner people or told the chancellor. The chancellor afterwards reduced his chariots and cavalry. The Beginning Emperor angered, saying: 'These inner people leaked my words.' He investigated and questioned, but none confessed. At that time, by edict he captured all those who had been at his side then, and killed them all. From this time after, none knew the location of his travels. He listened to affairs, ministers received decided affairs, all at Xianyang Palace.

Hou Sheng and Lu Sheng mutually plotted, saying: 'The Beginning Emperor as a person, by heaven's nature firm and fierce, self-using. He rose from the feudal lords, united the world. His intentions obtained what he desired, he thought from ancient times none reached himself. He specially employed prison officials, prison officials obtained close favor. Scholars though seventy people, specially prepared members but not used. The chancellor and various ministers all received completed affairs, relied on arguing at His Majesty. His Majesty takes pleasure in punishment and killing as might. The world fears crime and holds salaries, none dares to exhaust loyalty. His Majesty does not hear faults but is daily arrogant. Below, terrified and submissive, they falsely deceive to gain favor. Qin laws: not able to combine prescriptions if not verified, then death. However, observers of stars and qi numbered to three hundred people, all good scholars. They feared and avoided taboos, flattered, did not dare to speak uprightly of his faults. World affairs, no matter small or large, all decided at His Majesty. His Majesty even weighed writings with balance stones. Day and night there were submissions. If not hitting the submission, he could not rest. Greedy for power and influence to such an extent. He is not yet suitable for seeking the xian medicine.' Thereupon they then fled and went away. The Beginning Emperor heard they had fled, then greatly angered, saying: 'I previously collected the world's books that were not useful and removed them all. I completely summoned literature and prescription scholars in great numbers, wishing to raise great peace. The prescription scholars wished to refine to seek strange medicines. Now I hear that Han Zhong has gone and not reported. Xu Shi and others expended with huge ten-thousands count, finally not obtaining medicine. Only fraudulent profits mutually told, daily heard. Lu Sheng and others I honored and granted very thickly. Now they actually slander me, to increase my lack of virtue. The various scholars in Xianyang, I had people investigate and ask. Perhaps they made rebellious words to disorder the qianshou.' Thereupon he had the imperial secretary completely investigate and ask the various scholars. The various scholars transmitted and mutually told, implicating each other. Then he self-eliminated those who violated prohibitions, four hundred sixty more people. He pitted them all at Xianyang, made the world know it, to punish later ones. He moreover sent banished ones transferred to the border. The Beginning Emperor's eldest son Fusu remonstrated, saying: 'The world has just been determined, the qianshou of distant places have not gathered. The various scholars all recite and follow Confucius. Now His Majesty heavily restrains them with laws. I, your minister, fear the world will not be peaceful. Only Your Majesty examine it.' The Beginning Emperor angered, had Fusu go north to oversee Meng Tian at Shang commandery.

In the thirty-sixth year, Yinghuo guarded the heart. There was a falling star that descended in Dong commandery. It reached the earth and became a stone. The qianshou or carved on its stone: 'The Beginning Emperor dies and the earth divides.' The Beginning Emperor heard it and dispatched the imperial secretary to pursue and ask. None confessed. He completely took the dwellers beside the stone and executed them, then burned and melted its stone. The Beginning Emperor was not happy. He had the scholars compose poems about xian true persons, and whatever he toured in the world, he transmitted commands for musicians to sing and string them. In autumn, an envoy from east of the pass passed at night through the Huayin Pingshu road. Someone holding a jade disk blocked the envoy, saying: 'Leave this for me to Fen Pool jun.' He then said: 'This year the ancestral dragon dies.' The envoy asked its reason, then he suddenly was not seen. He placed its jade disk and left. The envoy offered the jade disk and completely reported it. The Beginning Emperor was silent for a long time, saying: 'Mountain ghosts certainly do not exceed knowing one year's matters.' He retired and spoke, saying: 'Ancestral dragons are the ancestors of people.' He had the imperial storehouse examine the jade disk. It was the jade disk sunk in the twenty-eighth year when traveling across the Jiang. Thereupon the Beginning Emperor divined it. The hexagram obtained travel and move as auspicious. He moved thirty thousand households to the north river and Yuzhong. Nobility one level was conferred.

In the thirty-seventh year, tenth month, Guichou day, the Beginning Emperor went out on tour. Left Chancellor Si followed, Right Chancellor Qu Ji guarded. Youngest son Hu Hai loved and admired, requested to follow. His Majesty permitted it. In the eleventh month, he traveled to Yunmeng, hoped and sacrificed to Yu Shun at Jiuyi Mountain. He floated down the Jiang, viewed Jike, crossed Haizhu. He passed Danyang, reached Qiantang. He approached the Zhejiang. The water waves were fierce. He then went west one hundred twenty li and crossed from the narrow middle. He ascended Kuiji, sacrificed to Dayu, gazed toward the Nanhai, and erected a stone carving praising Qin's virtue. Its text said:

The emperor's beautiful achievements pacified and unified within the universe. Virtue and benevolence were long extended. In the thirty-seventh year, he personally toured the world, comprehensively viewed distant places. He then ascended Kuiji, proclaimed and inspected customs and habits. The qianshou were fasting and solemn. The ministers recited merit, fundamentally originated affairs and traces, pursued and honored the high and bright. The Qin sage governed the state, began determining punishments and names, manifestly displayed the old statutes. Initially leveled laws and forms, carefully distinguished office responsibilities, to establish what is constant and regular. The six kings monopolized and were rebellious, greedy and ferocious, arrogant and fierce, led multitudes and strengthened themselves. Violent and cruel, unrestrained in conduct, relied on strength and were arrogant, frequently moved armored soldiers. Secretly connected idle envoys, with matters allied together, actions were evil and square. Internally adorned fraudulent plots, externally came and invaded borders, then arose calamities and misfortunes. Righteous might executed them, extinguished and extinguished the violent and perverse, chaos traitors extinguished and perished. Holy virtue broad and dense, in the six directions' middle, covered favor boundlessly. The emperor united the universe, comprehensively listened to myriad matters, distant and near all clear. Moved and managed all things, examined and verified matters and facts, each carried its name. Noble and base equally passed, good and bad displayed before, none had hidden feelings. Adorned and examined, proclaimed righteousness, had sons and married, doubled death not chaste. Prevented and separated inner and outer, prohibited licentiousness and dissipation, male and female pure and sincere. Husband made entrusted boar, killed him no crime, male upheld righteousness measure. Wife made fleeing marry, son not able mother, all transformed frugal and pure. Great governance cleansed customs, the world received the wind, covered and bestowed beautiful classics. All followed measure and tracks, harmonious and peaceful, sincere and encouraged, none did not obey commands. The qianshou cultivated purity, people were happy with the same standards, praised and preserved great peace. Later respectfully served the laws, constant governance without limit, carriages and boats not tilted. Attendant ministers recited achievements, requested this stone be carved, bright and hung beautiful inscription.

He returned and passed Wu, crossed from Jiangcheng. Along the seaside, north he reached Langye. Prescription scholars Xu Shi and others entered the sea to seek divine medicines. Several years not obtained, expenses many, feared reprimand. Then deceived, saying: 'Penglai medicines can be obtained, however often harmed by great jiao fish, therefore cannot reach. Wish to request good shooters to come together, see them then shoot with linked crossbows.' The Beginning Emperor dreamed he battled with the sea god, who was like a person's form. He asked for dream interpretation. Scholars said: 'Water gods cannot be seen, with great fish and jiao dragons as signs. Now His Majesty prayed and sacrificed prepared and respectful, yet has this evil spirit. Should remove and go, and good spirits can be brought.' Then he ordered those who entered the sea to carry tools for capturing giant fish, and himself with linked crossbow waited for great fish to appear and shot them. From Langye north to Rongcheng Mountain, not seen. Reached Zhifu, saw giant fish, shot and killed one fish. Then he went along the sea westward.

He reached Pingyuan Ford and fell ill. The Beginning Emperor hated to speak of death. The ministers none dared to speak of death matters. His Majesty's illness grew increasingly severe. He then made a sealed letter granting Prince Fusu, saying: 'Convene with the mourning at Xianyang and bury.' The letter was already sealed. It was at the place where Middle Carriage Bureau Chief Zhao Gao administered tally and seal matters, not yet given to an envoy. In the seventh month on Bingyin day, the Beginning Emperor collapsed at Shaqiu Terrace. Chancellor Si, because His Majesty collapsed outside, feared the various princes and the world would have change. He then secreted it and did not issue mourning. The coffin was loaded in a hearse cool carriage. Former favored eunuchs accompanied it. Wherever it reached, food was offered. The hundred officials memorialized affairs as before. The eunuchs then from the hearse cool carriage approved their memorialized affairs. Only son Hu Hai, Zhao Gao, and the favored eunuchs, five or six people, knew of His Majesty's death. Zhao Gao had previously often taught Hu Hai writings and prison laws and commands affairs. Hu Hai privately favored him. Gao then secretly plotted with Prince Hu Hai and Chancellor Si to break away the sealed letter the Beginning Emperor had granted Prince Fusu, and moreover deceived by making Chancellor Si receive the Beginning Emperor's testament at Shaqiu, establishing son Hu Hai as crown prince. He moreover made a letter granting Prince Fusu and Meng Tian, enumerating their crimes, and granted them death. The words are fully in the Biography of Li Si. They traveled, then from Jingxing reached Jiuyuan. They met summer. His Majesty's hearse carriage stank. He then edicted attendant officials to command carriages loaded with one stone of dried fish, to confuse its stench.

They traveled from the straight road to Xianyang and issued mourning. Crown Prince Hu Hai inherited the position and was the Second Generation Emperor. In the ninth month, they buried the Beginning Emperor at Lishan. The Beginning Emperor initially ascended the throne and excavated and treated Lishan. When he united the world, the world's convicts sent reached seventy more than ten thousand people. They excavated three springs, lowered copper and brought the coffin. Palace buildings, hundred officials, strange vessels, precious monsters - moved and stored, filled it. He commanded artisans to make machine crossbows and arrows. Whoever approached the excavations was then shot. He used mercury as the hundred streams, Yangtze rivers, and great seas, with machines mutually pouring. Above equipped with heavenly patterns, below equipped with earthly forms. He used mermaid fat as candles, measured those that did not extinguish for a long time. The Second Generation said: 'The former emperor's rear palace women who do not have sons, it is not proper for them to go out.' He commanded all to follow in death. Those who died were very many. The burial had already descended. Or said the artisans made machines. All who stored knew it. If the stored were heavy, then leaked. Great matters finished, already stored. Closed the middle passages, lowered the outer passage doors. Completely closed the artisans and stored ones. No again exiting ones. Planted grass and wood to resemble a mountain.

Second Generation Emperor first year, age twenty-one. Zhao Gao was Palace Attendant Commander, responsible for handling matters. He commanded the ministers to discuss honoring the Beginning Emperor's temple. Though ten thousand generations, they did not exceed being destroyed. Now the Beginning Emperor was the extreme temple. Within the four seas, all offered tribute duties, increased sacrifices. Rites were all prepared. Nothing to add. Former kings' temples were either in West Yong or in Xianyang. The emperor's ceremony should alone serve libation and sacrifice at the Beginning Emperor's temple. From Xiang Gong already below, they exceeded being destroyed. What was established altogether seven temples. The ministers with rites advanced sacrifice, honoring the Beginning Emperor's temple as the emperors' ancestor temple. The emperor again called himself 'I'.'

Thereupon the Second Generation then followed and used Zhao Gao, extending the laws and commands. He then secretly plotted with Zhao Gao, saying: 'The ministers do not submit, the officials are still strong, and the various princes will certainly contend with me. What to do about it?' Gao said: 'I, your minister, certainly wished to speak but did not dare. The former emperor's ministers were all the world's accumulated generations of famous noble people, who had accumulated merits and labors for generations mutually transmitted for a long time already. Now I, Gao, was originally small and lowly. Your Majesty fortunately praised and raised me, commanding me in an upper position to manage middle affairs. The ministers are dissatisfied. They specially with appearance follow as ministers, but their hearts actually do not submit. Now His Majesty goes out. Not taking this time to investigate the commanderies and counties' defenders and commandants who have crimes and execute them. Above to shake might throughout the world, below to remove those His Majesty in his lifetime disliked. Now the time does not model culture but decides at military force. I wish Your Majesty would then follow the time without doubt, then the ministers would not be able to plot. A bright lord collects and raises the remaining people, makes the lowly noble, the poor rich, the distant near, then upper and lower gather and the state is peaceful.' The Second Generation said: 'Good.' He then carried out executing the ministers and various princes. With crimes and faults, he connected and arrested a few close officials and three nobles. None were able to stand. Six princes were punished and died at Du. Prince JianglÃ¼ and his two brothers were imprisoned in the inner palace. Their crimes were discussed alone later. In the fourth month, the Second Generation returned to Xianyang, saying: 'The former emperor, because the Xianyang court was small, therefore built the Efang Palace as chamber and hall. It was not completed. His Majesty collapsed. Its workers were dismissed. Soil was returned to Lishan. Lishan matters are greatly finished. Now to abandon the Efang Palace without completing it would manifest the former emperor's raised affairs as faulty.' He again made the Efang Palace. Externally he pacified the four barbarians, like the Beginning Emperor had planned. He completely conscripted their able men, fifty thousand people, as garrisoned guards for Xianyang. He commanded them to be taught archery with dogs, horses, birds, and beasts. Those who should eat were many. The measure was not sufficient. In the seventh month, garrisoned soldiers Chen Sheng and others rebelled in the old Jing land, making 'Zhang Chu'. In the second year, winter, Chen She dispatched Zhou Zhang and others as generals west to Xi, with troops several tens of thousands. The Second Generation was greatly startled. The Second Generation moreover dispatched Chief Clerk Sima Xin and Dong Yi to assist Zhang Han in striking the robbers. They killed Chen Sheng at Chengfu, broke Xiang Liang at Dingtao, extinguished Wei Jiu at Linji. The Chu land robbers' famous generals had already died. Zhang Han then north crossed the river, striking Zhao king Xie and others at Julu.

Zhao Gao persuaded the Second Generation, saying: 'The former emperor controlled and ruled the world for a long time. Therefore the ministers did not dare do wrong, advance evil sayings. Now Your Majesty is rich in spring and autumns, have initially ascended the position. Why with nobles in court decide affairs? Affairs then have errors, show the ministers your shortcomings. The emperor calls 'I', certainly does not hear the voice.' Thereupon the Second Generation constantly resided in the forbidden quarters, deciding all affairs with Gao. After that, the nobles rarely obtained morning audiences. Robbers and bandits increasingly many. The Guanzhong soldiers dispatched east to strike robbers had no end. Right Chancellor Qu Ji, Left Chancellor Si, General Feng Jie advanced and remonstrated, saying: 'East of the pass bandits together rose. Qin dispatched troops to execute and strike. Those killed and perished were very many, however still not stopped. Robbers are many. All because garrison, transport, labor matters are bitter. Taxes are heavy. Please temporarily stop the Efang Palace workers, reduce and save the four borders' garrisons and transports.' The Second Generation said: 'I heard Master Han say: 'Yao and Shun's thatched rafters were not scraped, thatched roofs not trimmed, ate from earthenware bowls, drank from earthenware cups. Though gatekeeper's nourishment, not different from this. Yu dug Longmen, connected Daxia, decided Hetting waters, released to sea. His body self-held hoe and spade, shins had no hair. Minister and captive labor was not more intense than this.' All those who are noble in having the world obtain unrestrained intentions and extreme desires. The lord makes heavy and clear laws. Below they do not dare do wrong, to control and rule within the seas. The lords of Yu and Xia were noble as emperors, personally dwelt in the reality of poor bitterness, to comply with the common people. What more at laws? I am honored with ten thousand chariots, but not its substance. I wish to make thousand chariots' equipage, ten thousand chariots' retinue, to fill my title and name. Moreover the former emperor rose from feudal lords, united the world. The world was already settled. Externally expelled the four barbarians to pacify the border limits. Made palace chambers to manifest self-satisfaction. And you observe the former emperor's achievements had continuity. Now I have ascended the position within two years' interval. Bandits together rose. You cannot prohibit. Moreover wish to dismiss what the former emperor did. This is above not able to repay the former emperor, next not exhausting loyal strength for me. Why be in position?' Sent down Qu Ji, Si, Jie as officials. Investigated and blamed other crimes. Qu Ji and Jie said: 'Generals and chancellors are not humiliated.' They committed suicide. Si was finally imprisoned and received the five punishments.

ä¸‰å¹´ï¼Œç« é‚¯ç­‰å°‡å…¶å’åœé‰…é¹¿ï¼Œæ¥šä¸Šå°‡è»é …ç¾½å°‡æ¥šå’å¾€æ•‘é‰…é¹¿ã€‚ å†¬ï¼Œè¶™é«˜ç‚ºä¸ç›¸ï¼Œç«Ÿæ¡ˆææ–¯æ®ºä¹‹ã€‚ å¤ï¼Œç« é‚¯ç­‰æˆ°æ•¸å»ï¼ŒäºŒä¸–ä½¿äººè®“é‚¯ï¼Œé‚¯æï¼Œä½¿é•·å²æ¬£è«‹äº‹ã€‚ è¶™é«˜å¼—è¦‹ï¼Œåˆå¼—ä¿¡ã€‚ æ¬£æï¼Œäº¡å»ï¼Œé«˜ä½¿äººæ•è¿½ä¸åŠã€‚ æ¬£è¦‹é‚¯æ›°ï¼šã€Œè¶™é«˜ç”¨äº‹æ–¼ä¸­ï¼Œå°‡è»æœ‰åŠŸäº¦èª…ï¼Œç„¡åŠŸäº¦èª…ã€‚ã€ é …ç¾½æ€¥æ“Šç§¦è»ï¼Œè™œç‹é›¢ï¼Œé‚¯ç­‰é‚ä»¥å…µé™è«¸ä¾¯ã€‚ å…«æœˆå·±äº¥ï¼Œè¶™é«˜æ¬²ç‚ºäº‚ï¼Œæç¾¤è‡£ä¸è½ï¼Œä¹ƒå…ˆè¨­é©—ï¼ŒæŒé¹¿ç»æ–¼äºŒä¸–ï¼Œæ›°ï¼šã€Œé¦¬ä¹Ÿã€‚ã€ äºŒä¸–ç¬‘æ›°ï¼šã€Œä¸ç›¸èª¤é‚ªï¼Ÿ è¬‚é¹¿ç‚ºé¦¬ã€‚ã€ å•å·¦å³ï¼Œå·¦å³æˆ–é»˜ï¼Œæˆ–è¨€é¦¬ä»¥é˜¿é †è¶™é«˜ã€‚ æˆ–è¨€é¹¿ï¼ˆè€…ï¼‰ï¼Œé«˜å› é™°ä¸­è«¸è¨€é¹¿è€…ä»¥æ³•ã€‚ å¾Œç¾¤è‡£çš†ç•é«˜ã€‚
In the third year, Zhang Han and others as generals led their soldiers to surround Julu. Chu Supreme General Xiang Yu led Chu soldiers to go rescue Julu. In winter, Zhao Gao became chancellor and finally investigated and killed Li Si. In summer, Zhang Han and others battled several retreats. The Second Generation had a person reproach Han. Han feared and had Chief Clerk Xin request affairs. Zhao Gao did not see him, moreover did not believe. Xin feared, fled and went away. Gao had people seize and pursue but did not reach him. Xin saw Han and said: 'Zhao Gao uses affairs in the middle. The general has merit and is also executed, no merit and is also executed.' Xiang Yu urgently struck the Qin army, captured Wang Li. Han and others then with troops surrendered to the feudal lords. In the eighth month on Jihai, Zhao Gao wished to make chaos. Feared the ministers would not listen. He then first set a test, held a deer and offered it to the Second Generation, saying: 'A horse also.' The Second Generation laughed, saying: 'Chancellor mistaken? Calls a deer a horse.' He asked the attendants. The attendants were either silent, or said horse to flatter and follow Zhao Gao. Or those who said deer, Gao then secretly struck various who said deer with the law. After that, the ministers all feared Gao.

é«˜å‰æ•¸è¨€ã€Œé—œæ±ç›œæ¯‹èƒ½ç‚ºä¹Ÿã€ï¼ŒåŠé …ç¾½è™œç§¦å°‡ç‹é›¢ç­‰é‰…é¹¿ä¸‹è€Œå‰ï¼Œç« é‚¯ç­‰è»æ•¸å»ï¼Œä¸Šæ›¸è«‹ç›ŠåŠ©ï¼Œç‡•ã€è¶™ã€é½Šã€æ¥šã€éŸ“ã€é­çš†ç«‹ç‚ºç‹ï¼Œè‡ªé—œä»¥æ±ï¼Œå¤§æ°ç›¡ç•”ç§¦åæ‡‰è«¸ä¾¯ï¼Œè«¸ä¾¯å’¸ç‡å…¶çœ¾è¥¿é„‰ã€‚ æ²›å…¬å°‡æ•¸è¬äººå·²å± æ­¦é—œï¼Œä½¿äººç§æ–¼é«˜ï¼Œé«˜æäºŒä¸–æ€’ï¼Œèª…åŠå…¶èº«ï¼Œä¹ƒè¬ç—…ä¸æœè¦‹ã€‚ äºŒä¸–å¤¢ç™½è™é½§å…¶å·¦é©‚é¦¬ï¼Œæ®ºä¹‹ï¼Œå¿ƒä¸æ¨‚ï¼Œæ€ªå•å å¤¢ã€‚ åœæ›°ï¼šã€Œæ¶‡æ°´ç‚ºç¥Ÿã€‚ã€ äºŒä¸–ä¹ƒé½‹æ–¼æœ›å¤·å®®ï¼Œæ¬²ç¥ æ¶‡ï¼Œæ²ˆå››ç™½é¦¬ã€‚ ä½¿ä½¿è²¬è®“é«˜ä»¥ç›œè³Šäº‹ã€‚ é«˜æ‡¼ï¼Œä¹ƒé™°èˆ‡å…¶å©¿å’¸é™½ä»¤é–»æ¨‚ã€å…¶å¼Ÿè¶™æˆè¬€æ›°ï¼šã€Œä¸Šä¸è½è««ï¼Œä»Šäº‹æ€¥ï¼Œæ¬²æ­¸ç¦æ–¼å¾å®—ã€‚ å¾æ¬²æ˜“ç½®ä¸Šï¼Œæ›´ç«‹å…¬å­å¬°ã€‚ å­å¬°ä»å„‰ï¼Œç™¾å§“çš†è¼‰å…¶è¨€ã€‚ã€ ä½¿éƒä¸­ä»¤ç‚ºå…§æ‡‰ï¼Œè©ç‚ºæœ‰å¤§è³Šï¼Œä»¤æ¨‚å¬åç™¼å’ï¼Œè¿½åŠ«æ¨‚æ¯ç½®é«˜èˆã€‚ é£æ¨‚å°‡åå’åƒé¤˜äººè‡³æœ›å¤·å®®æ®¿é–€ï¼Œç¸›è¡›ä»¤ä»†å°„ï¼Œæ›°ï¼šã€Œè³Šå…¥æ­¤ï¼Œä½•ä¸æ­¢ï¼Ÿã€ è¡›ä»¤æ›°ï¼šã€Œå‘¨å»¬è¨­å’ç”šè¬¹ï¼Œå®‰å¾—è³Šæ•¢å…¥å®®ï¼Ÿã€ æ¨‚é‚æ–¬è¡›ä»¤ï¼Œç›´å°‡åå…¥ï¼Œè¡Œå°„ï¼Œéƒå®¦è€…å¤§é©šï¼Œæˆ–èµ°æˆ–æ ¼ï¼Œæ ¼è€…è¼’æ­»ï¼Œæ­»è€…æ•¸åäººã€‚ éƒä¸­ä»¤èˆ‡æ¨‚ä¿±å…¥ï¼Œå°„ä¸Šå¹„åå¹ƒã€‚ äºŒä¸–æ€’ï¼Œå¬å·¦å³ï¼Œå·¦å³çš†æƒ¶æ“¾ä¸é¬¬ã€‚ æ—æœ‰å®¦è€…ä¸€äººï¼Œä¾ä¸æ•¢å»ã€‚ äºŒä¸–å…¥å…§ï¼Œè¬‚æ›°ï¼šã€Œå…¬ä½•ä¸èš¤å‘Šæˆ‘ï¼Ÿ ä¹ƒè‡³æ–¼æ­¤ï¼ã€ å®¦è€…æ›°ï¼šã€Œè‡£ä¸æ•¢è¨€ï¼Œæ•…å¾—å…¨ã€‚ ä½¿è‡£èš¤è¨€ï¼Œçš†å·²èª…ï¼Œå®‰å¾—è‡³ä»Šï¼Ÿã€ é–»æ¨‚å‰å³äºŒä¸–æ•¸æ›°ï¼šã€Œè¶³ä¸‹é©•æ£ï¼Œèª…æ®ºç„¡é“ï¼Œå¤©ä¸‹å…±ç•”è¶³ä¸‹ï¼Œè¶³ä¸‹å…¶è‡ªç‚ºè¨ˆã€‚ã€ äºŒä¸–æ›°ï¼šã€Œä¸ç›¸å¯å¾—è¦‹å¦ï¼Ÿã€ æ¨‚æ›°ï¼šã€Œä¸å¯ã€‚ã€ äºŒä¸–æ›°ï¼šã€Œå¾é¡˜å¾—ä¸€éƒ¡ç‚ºç‹ã€‚ã€ å¼—è¨±ã€‚ åˆæ›°ï¼šã€Œé¡˜ç‚ºè¬æˆ¶ä¾¯ã€‚ã€ å¼—è¨±ã€‚ æ›°ï¼šã€Œé¡˜èˆ‡å¦»å­ç‚ºé»”é¦–ï¼Œæ¯”è«¸å…¬å­ã€‚ã€ é–»æ¨‚æ›°ï¼šã€Œè‡£å—å‘½æ–¼ä¸ç›¸ï¼Œç‚ºå¤©ä¸‹èª…è¶³ä¸‹ï¼Œè¶³ä¸‹é›–å¤šè¨€ï¼Œè‡£ä¸æ•¢å ±ã€‚ã€ éº¾å…¶å…µé€²ã€‚ äºŒä¸–è‡ªæ®ºã€‚
Gao had previously several times said 'East of the pass robbers are not able to do anything', and Xiang Yu captured Qin general Wang Li and others below Julu and advanced. Zhang Han and others' army several retreats. They memorialed requesting additional aid. Yan, Zhao, Qi, Chu, Han, Wei all established as kings. From east of the pass, for the most part all rebelled against Qin officials and responded to the feudal lords. The feudal lords all led their multitudes facing west. Pei Gong as general with several ten thousand people had already slaughtered Wuguan. He had a person privately approach Gao. Gao feared the Second Generation would anger and execute, reaching his person. He then declined illness and did not have morning audiences. The Second Generation dreamed a white tiger bit his left trace horse and killed it. His heart was not happy. He strangely asked for dream interpretation. The diviner said: 'The Jing water makes an evil spirit.' The Second Generation then purified at Wangyi Palace, wished to sacrifice to the Jing, and sank four white horses. He had an envoy reproach Gao with robber and bandit matters. Gao feared, then secretly plotted with his son-in-law Xianyang magistrate Yan Le and his younger brother Zhao Cheng, saying: 'His Majesty does not listen to remonstrations. Now affairs are urgent. He wishes to return calamity to my clan. I wish to change and place His Majesty, moreover establish Prince Ying. Zi Ying is benevolent and frugal. The common people all carry his words.' He had the Palace Attendant Commander as inner response, deceived by making as if there were great robbers. He commanded Le to summon officials and dispatch soldiers, pursue and rob Le's mother and place her in Gao's residence. He dispatched Le as general with officials and soldiers over a thousand people to Wangyi Palace hall gate. They bound the guard commander and deputy, saying: 'Robbers entered here. Why did you not stop them?' The guard commander said: 'The surrounding huts have soldiers set very carefully. How did robbers dare enter the palace?' Le then beheaded the guard commander, straight led officials entered, advanced shooting. The gentlemen and eunuchs were greatly startled. Some fled, some resisted. Those who resisted then died. Those who died were several tens of people. The Palace Attendant Commander with Le together entered and shot at His Majesty's canopy and seat curtains. The Second Generation angered, summoned the attendants. The attendants were all panicked and disturbed, did not fight. Beside there was one eunuch who served and did not dare leave. The Second Generation entered the inner quarters and said to him: 'Why did you not early tell me? It has reached to this!' The eunuch said: 'I, your minister, did not dare speak, therefore obtained wholeness. If they had made me, your minister, speak early, all would already be executed. How would I have obtained until now?' Yan Le advanced and approached the Second Generation, reproached him saying: 'You are arrogant and unrestrained, execute and kill without way. The world together rebels against you. You should make a plan for yourself.' The Second Generation said: 'Can the chancellor be seen?' Le said: 'Not possible.' The Second Generation said: 'I wish to obtain one commandery as king.' Not permitted. He again said: 'Wish to be a ten thousand households marquis.' Not permitted. He said: 'Wish with wife and children to be qianshou, compare to the various princes.' Yan Le said: 'I, your minister, received command from the chancellor, to execute you for the world. Though you have many words, I do not dare report.' He waved his troops to advance. The Second Generation committed suicide.

é–»æ¨‚æ­¸å ±è¶™é«˜ï¼Œè¶™é«˜ä¹ƒæ‚‰å¬è«¸å¤§è‡£å…¬å­ï¼Œå‘Šä»¥èª…äºŒä¸–ä¹‹ç‹€ã€‚ æ›°ï¼šã€Œç§¦æ•…ç‹åœ‹ï¼Œå§‹çš‡å›å¤©ä¸‹ï¼Œæ•…ç¨±å¸ã€‚ ä»Šå…­åœ‹å¾©è‡ªç«‹ï¼Œç§¦åœ°ç›Šå°ï¼Œä¹ƒä»¥ç©ºåç‚ºå¸ï¼Œä¸å¯ã€‚ å®œç‚ºç‹å¦‚æ•…ï¼Œä¾¿ã€‚ã€ ç«‹äºŒä¸–ä¹‹å…„å­å…¬å­å¬°ç‚ºç§¦ç‹ã€‚ ä»¥é»”é¦–è‘¬äºŒä¸–æœå—å®œæ˜¥è‹‘ä¸­ã€‚ ä»¤å­å¬°é½‹ï¼Œç•¶å»Ÿè¦‹ï¼Œå—ç‹ç’½ã€‚ é½‹äº”æ—¥ï¼Œå­å¬°èˆ‡å…¶å­äºŒäººè¬€æ›°ï¼šã€Œä¸ç›¸é«˜æ®ºäºŒä¸–æœ›å¤·å®®ï¼Œæç¾¤è‡£èª…ä¹‹ï¼Œä¹ƒè©³ä»¥ç¾©ç«‹æˆ‘ã€‚ æˆ‘èè¶™é«˜ä¹ƒèˆ‡æ¥šç´„ï¼Œæ»…ç§¦å®—å®¤è€Œç‹é—œä¸­ã€‚ ä»Šä½¿æˆ‘é½‹è¦‹å»Ÿï¼Œæ­¤æ¬²å› å»Ÿä¸­æ®ºæˆ‘ã€‚ æˆ‘ç¨±ç—…ä¸è¡Œï¼Œä¸ç›¸å¿…è‡ªä¾†ï¼Œä¾†å‰‡æ®ºä¹‹ã€‚ã€ é«˜ä½¿äººè«‹å­å¬°æ•¸è¼©ï¼Œå­å¬°ä¸è¡Œï¼Œé«˜æœè‡ªå¾€ï¼Œæ›°ï¼šã€Œå®—å»Ÿé‡äº‹ï¼Œç‹æŸ°ä½•ä¸è¡Œï¼Ÿã€ å­å¬°é‚åˆºæ®ºé«˜æ–¼é½‹å®®ï¼Œä¸‰æ—é«˜å®¶ä»¥å¾‡å’¸é™½ã€‚ å­å¬°ç‚ºç§¦ç‹å››åå…­æ—¥ï¼Œæ¥šå°‡æ²›å…¬ç ´ç§¦è»å…¥æ­¦é—œï¼Œé‚è‡³éœ¸ä¸Šï¼Œä½¿äººç´„é™å­å¬°ã€‚ å­å¬°å³ç³»é ¸ä»¥çµ„ï¼Œç™½é¦¬ç´ è»Šï¼Œå¥‰å¤©å­ç’½ç¬¦ï¼Œé™è»¹é“æ—ã€‚ æ²›å…¬é‚å…¥å’¸é™½ï¼Œå°å®®å®¤åºœåº«ï¼Œé‚„è»éœ¸ä¸Šã€‚ å±…æœˆé¤˜ï¼Œè«¸ä¾¯å…µè‡³ï¼Œé …ç±ç‚ºå¾é•·ï¼Œæ®ºå­å¬°åŠç§¦è«¸å…¬å­å®—æ—ã€‚ é‚å± å’¸é™½ï¼Œç‡’å…¶å®®å®¤ï¼Œè™œå…¶å­å¥³ï¼Œæ”¶å…¶çå¯¶è²¨è²¡ï¼Œè«¸ä¾¯å…±åˆ†ä¹‹ã€‚ æ»…ç§¦ä¹‹å¾Œï¼Œå„åˆ†å…¶åœ°ç‚ºä¸‰ï¼Œåæ›°é›ç‹ã€å¡ç‹ã€ç¿Ÿç‹ï¼Œè™Ÿæ›°ä¸‰ç§¦ã€‚ é …ç¾½ç‚ºè¥¿æ¥šéœ¸ç‹ï¼Œä¸»å‘½åˆ†å¤©ä¸‹ç‹è«¸ä¾¯ï¼Œç§¦ç«Ÿæ»…çŸ£ã€‚ å¾Œäº”å¹´ï¼Œå¤©ä¸‹å®šæ–¼æ¼¢ã€‚
Yan Le returned and reported to Zhao Gao. Zhao Gao then completely summoned the various ministers and princes, told them of the circumstances of executing the Second Generation. He said: 'Qin was formerly a kingdom. The Beginning Emperor ruled the world, therefore was called emperor. Now the six states again self-established. Qin land is increasingly small. To be emperor with an empty name is not possible. It is proper to be king as before. Convenient.' They established the Second Generation's elder brother's son, Prince Ying, as Qin king. They used qianshou to bury the Second Generation in the Yichun Park south of Du. They commanded Zi Ying to purify, should see in the temple, receive the king seal. He purified for five days. Zi Ying plotted with his two sons, saying: 'Chancellor Gao killed the Second Generation in Wangyi Palace. He feared the ministers would execute him. He then pretended with righteousness to establish me. I heard that Zhao Gao then agreed with Chu to extinguish the Qin clan residence and become king of Guanzhong. Now they make me purify and see the temple. This wishes to take advantage in the temple to kill me. I will claim illness and not go. The chancellor will certainly come himself. When he comes, then kill him.' Gao had a person invite Zi Ying several times. Zi Ying did not go. Gao indeed went himself, saying: 'Clan temple heavy matters. Why does the king not go?' Zi Ying then stabbed and killed Gao at the purification palace. He three-clanned Gao's family to display at Xianyang. Zi Ying was Qin king for forty-six days. Chu general Pei Gong broke the Qin army and entered Wuguan, then reached Bashang. He had a person agree on Zi Ying's surrender. Zi Ying immediately tied his neck with a cord, white horse and plain carriage, offered the emperor seal and talisman, surrendered at the roadside of Zhi. Pei Gong then entered Xianyang, sealed the palace chambers and treasuries storehouses, returned the army to Bashang. He resided more than a month. The feudal lords' troops arrived. Xiang Ji was the alliance leader. He killed Zi Ying and the Qin various princes and clan residence. He then slaughtered Xianyang, burned its palace chambers, captured its sons and daughters, collected its precious treasures and goods wealth. The feudal lords together divided them. After extinguishing Qin, each divided its land as three, named Yong king, Sai king, Di king, titled the three Qin. Xiang Yu became the west Chu overlord king, chief commanded to divide the world and king the feudal lords. Qin was finally extinguished. Five years later, the world was settled at Han.

Qin's land was covered by mountains and girded by rivers as solid fortifications. It was a country of four barriers. The Qin king was satisfied with himself and did not ask, then erred and did not change. The Second Generation received it, followed and did not change, violent and cruel to increase calamities. When it reached the Qin king, he continued the six generations' remaining achievements, shook the long whip and drove within the universe. He swallowed the two Zhou and perished the feudal lords. Zi Ying measured the sequence and obtained successor. Crowned with jade crown, wore splendid sash. Chariot with yellow canopy, followed by hundred officials. Visited the seven temples.
